text: Kasper and Tania arrived late so unfortunately we have few time to know each other, but they were very nice, respectful and discret. It was a real pleasure to host you. Hope we have the opportunity to get to know better in the futur, in France, Denmark or Mexico, or maybe on a bike !
Kasper was the perfect first timer! Polite, charming, adventurous and funny. He is a great conversationalist and very interested in experiencing new things. Kasper is welcome in my home anytime!
Was really one amazing experience to host Kasper. Very smart and really good energy. I hope I see you soon my friend.

I stayed one night at Kasper's place. He's very friendly and open and we spent a funny night with friends of Kasper in a nice café and bar! His apartment is pretty and in a good location. I enjoyed my time in Aarhus, although it was short. Thanks for hosting me Kasper :)
column18: {'text': 'Thank you too Johanna! It was a joy having you here. I really enjoyed your company, and wish you the best for your future travels. Kasper', 'author': {'id': '2007642765', 'publicName': 'Kasper Kehlet', 'publicAddress': {'id': '265929314', 'description': 'Aarhus, Aarhus Municipality, Denmark'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/ht-images.couchsurfing.com/u/2007642765/df683b7e-9d01-4dad-a793-613db68a44c3', 'status': 'maybe', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'createdDate': '2018-10-14T00:30:24Z'}

text: Kasper is a very good host and it’s was wonderful to hang  out. I’ll always stay at that place when I’m in Aarhus. Thank you dear Kasper!
A very friendly, welcoming and knowledgeable person who will - I'm sure -  host you with the same pleasure as he did for me !

Kasper was a great host!! He is welcoming, pleasant, easy going person. Kasper invited us to spend time at board games. 
And also gave us a ride to the airport.

Thank you so much for sharing your flat, your time and good company! 
Hope we cross path again and you are always welcome whereever I will find a flat... ;)
Good luck with everything!

Kasper is the best host,I have ever had on couchsurfing in my life. I postponed my trip for two months and he was flexible to host me on new dates. We chatted for almost two months and before my arrival already created a great friendship.Kasper hosted me for two nights.He picked me up from bus station and showed me the city and the best rooftop bars in Aarhus.The second afternoon he cooked a dinner and offered beer and wine, which was very generous and kind, after that he used his membership card in museum to bring me for free and show me museum.Kasper is very very very polite, kind, respectful and generous person.He also suggested me using danish app to get a ride from city to airport which is cheaper way than bus. Kasper is the best example of a Dane and very original example of one Scandinavian or Nordic person.His politeness and kindness are really on very high level.Kasper is in love with his city Aarhus and he enjoys every corner of it.You really have to meet him! Mange Tak!!

I could not be much happier with my couch surfing experience with Kasper! He has been available for all the questions I have had beforehand and helpful when I needed help. 

As a host he has been everhthing I could hope for.. and beyond! We spent all of my time in Aarhus together, he is a very chilled person, easy to talk to, with a very open minded view of the world! He made brunch for us on the first morning, took me to visit Aarhus (which he has very much in his heart and also knows a lot about), then entertained me with what's there to do in this beautiful city. He might also teach you a dice game at a local bar, be aware - he is pretty good at it! 

C'était un plaisir Kasper! Thanks ever so much for sharing your home, time and personality with me - Now, "c'est ton tour" to come and visit England or the south of France! It would be "un plaisir" to show you around my countries. Take a great care of yourself - Laura
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Leeds, England, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

text:
If you're looking for the cliché, introvert Dane, don't crash at Kasper's! 😀 He will lead you to plenty of cool places in Aarhus and tell you a number of stories about them. You'll be likely to eventually end out the night pub crawling or eating some exotic or traditional food. Doesn't matter if you're gonna getting hosted during a week day, he'll find energy and time! 

Also hosting was nice and smooth. Kasper is still pretty fresh in CS, but well educated, flexible and helpful, besides of being an hard traveller. He lives in a cool, clean loft well located in the city. There you'll probably organize some dinners or drink some wines out of its tiny balcony.

I thank you again for being the last host of my long guesting experience in Aarhus, dude! I'm sure we'll hangout, play with stats and numbers, or simply chat for many other times during my stay! ;)

Kasper... What can I say. He was amazing since the first minute we've met. His flat was perfect, a bit small, but cozy, clean and in perfect location. I felt like I'm meeting an old friend. He showed us many nice places, took us to the city centre, and we were partying together. If you consider staying with Kasper, just do it. I also felt in love with Aarhus - it is a small city, perfect for chilling and partying. I had an amazing time. 
P.S. This guy knows how to party and mix alcoholic beverages :D

He is really nice and hospitable person. His home is in the center, very tidy and clean :) He recommended us good places to go. We had fun together! Had tasty dinners, enjoyed the balcony and barbecue. Also he knows many different funny games. So you can be his guest or host him without thinking!

Kasper is very kind person, sociable and welcoming! It was nice time with him, he showed us some special places in the city centre. After, we drink beer and play very interesting play:))
If you host him or be hosted by him you will not regret!
And thank you for everything :)
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: London, England, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

text: Kasper gave me an evening that I will not easily forget. Despite being a working day, Kasper arranged to spend as much time as possible in my company, managing to make me feel at home in a very short time. Right away, he took me for a walk to see the city lights of the city at night, stopping at one of his favorite pubs to sip an extraordinary Dutch beer and teaching me to play backgammon until 2 am. Thanks again for the kindness, the  friendship and the human connection you offered me: I hope to see you soon! :-)
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark

text: Tore is a very fun person, and an excellent guest!

Pacifistically hunting, catching  and capturing moths, letting them free afterwards was one of our joint activities and convictions. Do i really have to say more?

Well. Tore, interesting guy from head to toe and inside out, open and kind.

Thanks for letting me stay!
Tore is a host who take care and time for his guest. He made a delicious vegan dinner and show me around in Aarhus. He is a peaceful, open and thoughtful person. Always welcome in Belgium !

Tore - an exquisite human being. From the very beginning it's easy to feel extremely comfortable in his company.  
An appartment - couldn't be better, location close to everthing that's interesting and worth seeing. Chapeau bas for a very high standard and good vibes!
We got along very fast, were cooking together, watching stuff, having a sightseeing trip and making the world a better place.
I highly recommend Tore as a host and a person himself! <hope to see you somewhere someday>

Tore host me for one week on his house; was a busy week for him, full of job, but anyway, he didn't hesitate in give me a place. Tore is really nice and easygoing guy; He bring me a key and a private room. The flat is well located, in middle of the city center; Near to super markets, parks and all the atractions of Åarhus. If you are looking for a nice cs experience, he is the one.

I would definitely host Luca again! :)

Although his swingback to CS is pretty recent, Luca didn't forget about how being a great surfer and a cool guy. He is really humble and easy-going, you will soon get to know him as an old friend and probably experience his cook skills.

He kept tidy and clean and was respectful with the house rules. You'll probably find plenty of stories to share, since he got many  interests and travelled pretty a lot.

But above all, you will get surprised about how much Luca is warm-hearted and selfless! Hosting him you will get a good friend and a pub-crawl companion. ;)

Luca hosted me back during my last night in Denmark. We had the chance to become friends and he confirmed to be a warm-hearted guy, flexible and thoughtful.

Home is a cool flat in the Latin Quartier of Aarhus, cosy and spacious. You'll have fun with him and experience best places in town to party, eat and enjoy around.

Don't lose the chance to get hosted from Luca and to get along with him! :)

Mauricio is an absolute legend! Stayed with me for a few days and we got along super well. Up for a great conversation, always free to hang out (or not if I was busy) and a very thoughtful guest. I would highly recommend Mauricio to anybody who is thinking about hosting him! 👌🏽

Mauricio is such an amazing guy!! He hosted my friend Paola and me for two nights and he truly made us feel home. He is funny and very easy going. We had great talks and we even went to a karaoke night. I would definitely recommend him. It was a pleasure to meet you Mauricio, hope to see you soon :)
Andreas it s a nice adventure  man with many interesant stories to say from all around world!!
Andreas was a great guest. He was extremely laid back and courteous. He had many interesting stories to tell and I would highly recommend you to host him. All the best.
response: {'id': '17377887', 'text': "I staid 3 nights in Amanullahs flad. Rally nice place. He is a cool  friendly and nice person. I know ho to contact next time I'm in hes neighborhood. \nAll Best Andreas", 'createdDate': '2015-04-08T21:13:02Z', 'experience': 'positive', 'relationshipType': 'other', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '4500162'}, 'from': {'id': '2000165738', 'publicName': 'Andreas Sørensen', 'publicAddress': {'id': '86032269', 'description': 'Aarhus, Central Denmark Region, Denmark'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/ht-images.couchsurfing.com/u/2000165738/fc5fec12-e760-4730-a6d8-3e80eb2fe204', 'status': 'yes', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

text: We stayed in Andreas amazing home for two nights. Unfortunately we didn't have much time to spend together, only first evening. He didn't mind that we are not spending much time together. We could come back to his place when we wanted (even at midnight) and we didn't have to leave when he was going to work. It was a big pleasure to meet him, he is an amazing host.

Andreas was a lovely host and I appreciated how he tried to make the effort to have conversation despite being busy with work. A very friendly guy-and I couldn't be more thankful for the hospitality :))
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: London, England, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

text:
Andreas was an amazing couch! He received me and my friend, Lucia, and gave si is warm welcome.
He lives in a beautiful and comfortable house, in a nice neighborhood. 
We had a  really good time talking about travels. He has good stories about sailing hahaha.
We hanged around in the city, drunk some beers and enjoyed the Aarhus festival.
We made a fire and a bbq on our last day. And we tried some homemade wine that himself produced in south of France, that’s another good story (really tasty and good wine) 
That night I played some music with my guitar and he played the horn hahahaha. It was very funny. We hope to meet Andreas again!
Thanks for everything Andreas.
Emilio and Lucia.

Wonderful time spent in Aarhus! We immediately felt at ease. He's an open-minded and outgoing guy who made us feel as we were at home, with a good dinner, great stories, red wine and relaxing, pleasant atmosphere, as well as good music. We really enjoyed his place (full of green spaces, which we loved) and his suggestion about places to visit in Aarhus, amazing! Thanks for all

Andreas is super a super nice guy with a true traveller mind. Thanks a lot for all your trust and that I had such a comfortable time in Aarhus. Even tho we didn't spend to much time together I appreciated the funny conversations that and the meals that we shared (also with his sister who is very friendly aswell). 
Thank you for the Kammerjunkere and I hope to see you again sometime! You are always welcome in Arnhem :)

Wonderful stay with Andreas. From the 1st minute at his house we felt at home. He trusts us, he believes in the goodness of others. After 6 couchsurfing experiences I could say it is the best ! Tak Andreas, please come to France and visit me, or Copenhague to visit Corentin ;)
Warm hugs
Opaline

Andreas is one of nicest and warmest person I’ve ever meet, we laughed so much, had a bbq at his place, he picked me up from the station and gave me a lift back even when it was v early in the morning. I couldn’t find anyone better and he’s simply an amazing person. The bus stop is literally 3 mins walking and around 20 minutes from town. He’s just outstanding!!

Staying at Andreas place was amazing! He was extremely available even if he had to work and we didn't have the occasion to spend a lot of time together! But the time was fantastic! Andreas is really easy going and open minded and his house is very.. hygge ;) I tried my best at least to cook a decent pasta ahah surely and hopefully we'll meet again! Thank you for everything!

Andreas was incredibly considerate and flexible to offer his home at the last minute with me.  I sent a request the day before arriving in Aarhus and Andreas quickly replied. He also arranged to pick me up, which was great because his place is a bit tricky to find. His home is quiet, clean, peaceful and embodies the Danish hygge.  Perfect resting place.
Thank you so much Andreas!

Andreas was so helpful during my first trip to Aarhus! He was willing to pick me up on his way home and lent me a bike for a day around the city! He even had a few city maps to help me plan out my day. Very thoughtful host and very glad this was my first couch surfing experience!!
I stayed with Andreas for 4 days and he was friendly and helpful from the very start. A hardworking guy with a great sense of humour and cool little place. Can't recommend him enough. Cheers Andreas!
He was very friendly and trustworthy from the start, and we felt welcomed to his home immediately, would highly recommend.
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark

text:
Andreas is a great host. He was very friendly. He travelled a lot and has interesting experiences to talk about.
He is welcoming. He even accepted that we stayed one night more!
I would definitely recommend him!

It was my first trip on Couchsurfing and Andreas made it a great experience.
He was absolutly friendly and staying with him was really nice!! :)
I would always do the trip again

The only unfortunate side of staying Andreas was that it was so short! We arrived late at night and left early in the morning, in thatbrief time though he was a gracious host. Hopefully in the future our paths will cross again

Andreas is a great host. It was my first time doing couchsurfing and I would say it could be my best experience for couchsurfing. I felt really welcomed. When I arrived he made BBQ and we had a nice evening together chatting about travelling, life and so one in his "hyggeligt" (cozy) house. I was so impressed when I stepped in. I felt like home. 
Unfortunately we didn't had time to hang out so much because I visited a friend in Aarhus.  
But I would definitely come back and can really recommend this place!
Thank you very much for hosting me Andreas! You made my stay!
It really felt like holidays!
Have a nice summer! :-)

Andreas is what you could expect from a host. He is a wonderful, thoughtful and fun person. He waited for me to arrive at his lovely home and welcome me with a great Danish bbq. With Jørgen, his friend, we had a night stroll and pub crawl in the city and I could have the chance to meet his lovely friends too. I spend two great nights staying with him, and highly recommend Andreas as a host and guest. You have a place to stay in Jakarta. Please take care of my plant :). 
Thank you for all, Andreas. See you later.
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Jakarta, Jakarta Special Capital Region (Java), Indonesia

text: Andreas was a great host. I had the chance to stay at his place for two nights (He offered my friend and I to stay for an extra-night and it was very appreciated), we shared dinners and stories. He was very flexible and easy-going and his house is lovely, ❤️ Mange Tak Andreas. Xx

Andreas is friendly, laid-back, down-to-earth and generous. He has a really nice little cottage in a gorgeous setting during the summer, and a great group of friends. I reckon he'd make a great guest as well. Do meet him! =D

text:

Andreas is very friendly, open minded, fun and relax. 
Enjoy your life and have fun on your sailing trip! :D

text: Andreas hosted my friend and I for Northside festival even though two other people were already staying in his (beautiful) city summer house and we are grateful for that. Though we didn't get to hang out much, I think he is very sweet. We really felt welcome in his home. See you again one day!

text: Andreas made  my weekend in Århus an unforgettable experience. He extended me a warm welcome at his cozy summer cottage with a late evening vegetarian barbecue, interesting chat about life and travelling, and a day trip along the coastal line at the Moesgård forest. Despite his leg injury, he patiently walked the 15 km stretch with me, without a word of complaint. When I was at his place, he told me: "Make yourself comfortable, this is your home." It made me feel truly at home away from home. This is what couch surfing is about. No cold impersonal  hotel stays but heartfelt hospitality. Because of my stay with Andreas, I now have very warm feelings for Denmark.

text:
Daniel and his girlfriend were very friendly, we had interesting discussions and we all here (with my housemates) appreciated the evening we spent together. In add I would say I was impressed by their ability to manage hitchhiking, that is not easy at all! 
Have a good tryp back to Danemark guys, you're welcome whenever you need in Beauvais!
Cheers 
François
Daniel is a great guest 👍

Daniel stayed with me for a couple nights. Super rad guy. I unfortunately had to work and didn't get a chance to show him my country. Very trustworthy soul. He looked after my dog when I was out. Best of luck on your travels Daniel !!

un gusto conocer a Daniel¡¡¡  con gusto lo hospedaria de nuevo...¡¡¡  es un poco ageno a las costumbres de los mexicanos, pero es muy respetuoso,  y habla exelente español, y en general¡¡¡  es muy buena persona,  espero encuentre mas gente en su viaje¡¡¡

Daniel is a great guy, it was a pleasure to meet you and have you at home. !! 
Hope to see u again !

We meetDaniel and one friend, in CS Meeting, they are new on Couchsurfing, they asked for a place to stay, and we decide to help. And was an amazing experience. They are very happy,cool, and have many things to tell. We really appreciate host you, and we wish all the best in your trip around South America !! 
Highly recommended. 
Abraços 

Ri and Rafa

text: I had a fun stay at Daniel's place! He was really sweet, flexible and helpful! I had everything I need for a short stay in lovely Aarhus :) Definitely recommended!
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark

text: Daniel was not there, but his flatmates welcomed me and I had his room to stay in which was wonderful! I would come back any time!
Daniel was great, even if he wasn’t home he left me his room. That was super nice from him 😊
Daniel and his roommates were great to stay with! Location is perfect and they were a lot of fun to hang out with.

Daniel was out of town, but managed to accept my request and coordinate with his room mates and another guest so I could stay in his room even when he wasnt there. Really nice house mates, and I had a fun and comfortable night in Aarhus!

Thanks again Daniel,
Firat

Whatbto say? My request was accepted in some 60 seconds! :D
I was hosted by distance since he was away, but both the stay and communication were smooth.
Home is also perfectly located, close to the center and in front of the botanical gardens.

I only stayed at Daniel's place for two nighs and I had a really great time. Daniel was really kind and let me stay there even though he had exam that week. I also met some of his roommates and they were really kind as well. He was very flexible on time which made it much easiere for me. I would definitely recommend staying with Daniel. I wish you luck on your exam! Take care :)
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Svendborg, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark

text: I had a great time in Aarhus. And with Daniel as host, my passage was all the more memorable! thank you!
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Nantes, Pays de la Loire, France

text:
Unfortunately, couldn't spend much time with him as he has some engagements . Daniel is a travel enthusiast but a sorted soul. He has quite good knowledge about Denmark. He introduced me to some of the amazing places of Denmark which I am planning to visit on my next trip.

He also guided and motivated me to hitchhike. And yea, i did it successfully from Aarhus to Copenhagen. 😊😊 
I would be thanlful to him for filling me with positive thoughts for the same. 

Would definitely recommend staying with him.

I wrote Daniel on Saturday morning and he accepted my request really quickly, in the afternoon I was already knocking on his door. He wasn't home, but his flatmates were. I felt little bit as Penny from The Big Bang Theory, when they were talking about different topics and sometimes I was lost, but mostly amused.
Alex, one of the flatmates, gave me a quick tour around the city and afterwards we went to houseparty. It was very funny and I met a lot nice people. Guys were very caring and when I asked them to go home, they did not hesitate and went with me even though I knew the way and I had my keys. I slept in hammock and it was sooo cool. Next day I went to explore the city and later I just picked up my stuff with no problems. It was amazing experience and I hope I will have chance to visit guys at least one more time.
Thank you for everything!

I stayed 4 nights with Daniel- 2 of them he was not home but left me his room, which was super nice. His flat mates welcomed me, we cooked on several of the nights and shared some beers and good talks. A super relaxed and welcoming athmosphere, I can only recommend staying there.  The center is pretty close as well and the University (which was convenient for me), too.
Thanks again for having me!

We stayed at Daniel's for 4 nights. We were supposed to arrive later, but our plans changed, so Daniel kindly asked his roommates to meet and help us. Everybody was very friendly and fun. Unfortunately, we didn't have a chance to get to know Daniel better as he had to visit his parents that time (so he gave whole his room with keys to us), but he seems like a very nice and kind person. He also gave us useful advice on sightseeing in Aarhus :)

My 3 day's stay with Daniel and his roommates couldn't have been better. He wasn't home when I arrived so one of his roommates received me (sorry to wake you up Alex 😂). 
The apartment is pretty near the downtown, some museums and the University, so there's no need to take busses. Just... walk.
Daniel is super easygoing and if he has the time you can expect some really good city walks and long conversations in the kitchen. He also loves food so don't hesitate to share a dinner with him 🙂.
Thanks for everything Daniel, I looking forward to see you again.

Hey! Daniel and his Gang are super chilled and outgoing. You would feel more than welcome staying with these dudes and enjoy funny conversations between ‘the Vikings’ :))) 
Though we didn’t have much time to hang out, I did enjoy little “quality time” very much! Thank you for all the hospitality. All the best to Daniel and the Gang!!!

Daniel is a very cool, relaxed guy, living together with easygoing flatmates. I really liked the students flair there and thinking of 5 men sharing an appartment I was surprised how well-ordered it was. :) Daniel was thoughtful about my arrival, he cooked tasty soup, I had a perfect workplace and I enjoyed our nightwalk by the seaside. It was nice to meet him - you're always welcome in Austria!

Daniel was actually not in town when I came to Aarhus, but he let me stay in his room while he was gone (and even let me stay a day earlier when my accommodation plans the day before fell through)! I did hang out with Daniel's other friends that live with him in their apartment, and they were all great guys! They taught me how to play Risk and I felt as if I was at home with my own friends while I was there. Even though I never met Daniel I can highly recommend him as a host...he was super flexible and checked in on me to make sure I had gotten to his apartment ok. Thanks for everything and wish you guys the best
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark

text: Daniel is very interesting and thoughtful about what you want to do. As two travellers, we shared a lot of things about each other road trips around a beer. A perfect cool host :)

It was my first experience and  I can't be more thankful with him. He was nice, talkative, funny, and really really good host. 
The first day he showed me around the city, he cooked for me and we were talking about life. The next days we shared some food and I had the opportunity of meeting his roommates. 
Don't doubt about staying with him. :) 
Wish you the best, Daniel
I had a great time with Daniel. He showed me the city, we went to visit a beautifull museum, made me try typical danish food :). Thank you!!!

Daniel helped me out last minute and let me crash in his room while he was away, and I met him when he came back. The guys that live there with him are fun and helpful, we had dinner together and they invited me along to a house party my first night. Such an easy going household with a communal spirit, I stayed 4 days but felt I'd been there for years :p

Daniel also offered tips and encouraged me to hitchhike, and with experiences like his how could I wimp out in Denmark of all places? He gave me the final shove I needed and it was great, much appreciated! I really hope to meet him and the gang again one day, they are cool guys to have around. Thanks again Daniel, Aleks, Stick, and Rasmus :)

It was a pleasure to stay with Daniel. He is a great guy and has really interesting stuff to stay. If you want to chill and do some exploring yourself he's cool with that but is also keen to hang out and show you around the city. His apartment is also in a really good location. I'd be more than happy to return the favour and host him if he ever comes to Ireland. Thanks Daniel!
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Donaghadee, Down, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

text:
He is an amazing host. We stayed in his apartment for two days and it was really nice, it's a nice and comfy flat, really good situed in the city.
The first night he was not at home, but one of his mates went out to a club with us, really great!! The next day Daniel arrived from his parents home with deer meat that they haunted and he cooked it for us with a really great typical sauce and some vegetable! It was delicious :P
After that we went to listen some live music in a park near his apartment and we talked for a while! It was a really good weekend!! 
Hope to see you soon guys, I would definitly come back again!!

Daniel is an experienced hitchhiker and traveler, he has funny stories to tell :) kind and open person. i enjoyed staying with him, meeting his housemates and understanding better how danish people are :)
we also hanged out in the city, so if you want to explore Aarhus, don't feel shy to ask him)

What should i say about Daniel...
he is just Great...!
he lives close to the city and park, we went out together with his friends the first night. And i enjoyed staying at his place even when i only stayed two nights :/ 
Would recomment him to anyone!

Daniel es un chico genial. Muy atento, amable y flexible. Ha viajado mucho y tiene muchos buenos consejos sobre cómo hacerlo. Además, dimos un paseo por Aarhus y me enseñó sitios de la ciudad muy chulos.Muy buena experiencia y muy recomendable. Daniel! estás invitado cuando quieras a Granada!!

Daniel did a fantastic communication.
He reacted 10 min after my request. He is very flexible and easy going.
I stayed on a comfortable mattress in the same room like  him.
Very clean place. Friendly people. I had a short but great time!
Daniel, thank you again!!

I have a great time at Daniel's! Daniel is very knowledgeable; he has traveled a lot and he is really curious. We both love areas that are not too crowded with great nature, so it was a good fit! Daniel is super relax and laid-back, so there is zero stress with him. Very flexible, polite, helpful, mature! Great qualities! I highly recommend him. Daniel is a great guy!

Absolute pleasure to have Jose stay with me. He's up for a good time and a laugh. Gave me a hand moving my boat on a windy evening and we managed to get it to point B safely. Decent at backgammon as well. Had a good teacher! Oh and he's awesome at washing dishes! Modern age man. Good luck with the "study." I hope we will cross paths again.
Jeppe is such a good host ! He is really interesting, shows me Aarhus and danish food. I really recommend him as an host, you should meet him :)

I decided to go to Aarhus very spontaneously and he accepted my last minute request. He is friendly, kind and fun. We met at the city center and walk around together. We had a good conversation about cinema and went Asian market together. He cooked his own style Bulgogi(Korean cuisine) for me...hahahaha  I watched his documentary films. It was really good. I wanted to talk more and watch some Korean films together but unfortunately, I had to leave early the next morning.  I had such a nice time in Aarhus thanks to Jeppe. Thank you for hosting me and hope our path cross again.  :-)
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Exeter, England, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

text:
Jeppe! What a great host. Firstly he picked me up at the tram-station, then we went to a place for excellent sandwiches, drank beers at some awesome student’s pub and had a really nice chat in the evening. Everyone should be lucky to get hosted by Jeppe!

He also showed me some of his own film productions, which I really liked. And the location of his flat is in a perfect area, next to the University.

I wish I could have stayed longer with you in Aarhus. But I’m already looking forward to hosting you in Vienna :) Hopefully I’m seeing you soon, Jeppe!

Jeppe is a great guy who put a lot of effort into making my stay perfect. He cook a very good diner twice, was flexible in arrival/departure and in general we had a good time hanging out. He knows a lot about football and is willing to help you in finding nice things to do in Aarhus. Definitely recommend!
Jeppe is a warm welcoming guy that everybody would like to hang out with. His skills in cards against humanity are outstanding! Thanks for having us at your place :)

Jeppe is honestly a cool dude to chill with. He picked me up after work and got me a hot dog and showed me around Aarhus. I’ve been traveling for 7 months and just wanted to chill, watch tv, and relax and Jeppe was totally cool with it. So we went back to his home and watched episodes of Anthony Bourdain’s Parts Unknown to some beers and dinner that Jeppe graciously made. Which was exactly what I needed from constantly being on the road. 

He’s a kind and hospitable host, glad we got to hangout and thanks for letting me stay with you!

I was welcomed with a can of beer and an home made stew! :)
Therefore, we had fun together and Jeppe shown me the clips he realized.
He is really fun and flexible, a welcoming and honest host that I surely suggest.
Thank you!
I had a ood time watching the world Cup with Jeppe and having some beers and I really appreciated the effort he put in to show me some Danish culture
It was super! Great fun, shared a lot in common and Jeppe has a lot of knowledge to share about misc things! If you like good movies, TV, food and football, you'll have a super time :)

My stay in Aarhus was short but it was so nice to meet Jeppe. He is really welcoming and a very interesting person you should definitively meet!
Thank you again Jeppe and see you somewhere on the planet !
I had a really great time at Jeppe's place. He was very friendly and open and I felt at home. He was also very thoughtful and I enjoyed my time at his place. Best wishes, Jeppe! :D
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Svendborg, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark

text: Amanda is an easygoing girl with a big and taking smile. A funny person who travelled a lot and learnt many experiences from her journeys. I hope to see her again. Have a nice return at home in Denmark!

Amanda and her friend stayed at my place for one night, so we didn't get to hang out this much which is a shame, both were really easy going and funny, and they easily adjusted themselves to my work schedule causing no problems at all. I would definitely recommend hosting her.

We were very happy to host Amanda for her first CS experience. The children were on holidays, and I was buy organising our next trip so I was not available for much showing around, but Amanda was happy to have a break from visiting and she enjoyed playing the piano, which she can play as a professional! She spent time talking and playing with the children at home, at the swimming pool, and she bought the ingredients for a cooking workshop. With my daughter, she made delicious cinammon rolls from her childhood and a Thaï dish from her recipe book.
We'll all keep good memories of her stay.
Amanda is really cool, I didn't get much time to hang out with her but she seems very nice and we got along really well. Couch was great!

Morten is a nice special guy who gave us a warming welcome even if we surprised him by showing up a little earlier than expected. He did everything for us to feel home and comfy. We had a nice dinner and good conversations! :)

We were so happy to stayed at Morten & Chika's flat. It was instantly felt like home, because they're super kind and friendly to us. They're genuinely lovely couple, funny, and inspiring. We had a nice dinner and conversation together, it was so memorable! Thanks for having us, and hope to see you guys again next time. Kærlig hilsen Yonna & Lyka ❤️
Morten et sa femme étaient très gentils et attentionnés ! On a partagé de bons repas ensemble et nous ont bien conseillé sur les choses à voir dans la ville ! C'était super ! Merci beaucoup à vous !

Horten and Chika are amazing and such a sweet couple! Horten is very special ;) and kind person, ready to help and give advice. We were glad to be a part of their family and have fun together, just watch football and tennis, trying to put pandas using chopsticks (I'm so bad with that). Special thanks for letting us stay at home while raining. We could wait and choose a convenient time for going out. We are happy for your family and waiting you in Belarus!

Morten is a really nice person and host :).
He helped me to find the places and best ways to go where I have to go. He cooks really good and we enjoy the conversation. 
He make me feel free to spend my day as I want to and spend time knowing each other.
Definitely if I come back to Aarhus, I will ask him to be my host.
:)

I admire Morten for hosting me despite that he has fallen ill. He is a generous host with a passion for food which I had made Sichuan & Hunan cuisine for him. He is open-minded & can talk about anything. I'm glad he liked some of my favorite J-Pop artists that I introduced.

Morten is a cool guy, very friendly and thoughtful. I only stayed one night, but Morten made sure I felt at home nevertheless. We shared a conversation about multiple topics and he offered me the most delicious meal - beef stew with mushrooms, sausages and cream - because cream makes everything better! The guy can really cook :) He also gave me space to rest up as I was tired from traveling.
Thank you for your wishes and  for being so kind to let me crash at your place even if it was just for one night :)

Morten is a lot of fun and a great host! We had drinks together, listened to music and talked about traveling and what it is like to meet through CS. He wants to go to Japan next year so please make him feel as welcome as he is doing it at his place :)
Thank you for a great time!

We had such a great stay with Morten! He invited us to eat with some of his friends who cooked an amazing dinner and were really friendly. He made us feel really confortable and talked to us as if he had known us for years. Told us about Aarhus and what to visit, and cooked a delicious breakfast. I would definitely recommend staying with him. Thanks Morten!

Morten is such a interesting and thoughtful guy who showed me around the city with bike and discovered the amazing part of the city. I felt so relaxed when I was with him, he is so easygoing and helpful all the time, he even made me a wonderful breakfast and cleaned my bike, I really enjoyed the time spending with him, thank you man!

Morten is a great guy. We stayed in his apartment for only one night, but from the first moment liked him very much and enjoyed his company, talking and laughing till deep midnight.
Morten is fond of bicycles and traveling, he knows many funny stories, so you will enjoy his company as we did. His advices about interesting places of Aarhus were very useful.
Thank you, Morten, we wish you travel a lot, good mood, great friends and see you some day in Saint Petersburg!

Morten is a nice person .i am so glad  that I was his first guest .i would really recommend this guy to stay with him and host him too.he came to pick me up also he has showed me around the city and his area too . We have talked a lot about lots of things ,he even gave me his charge for my iPhone because mine got broken again .i hope to see u again and go for a traveling man .thank u so much

Easy going guy. 
Didn't spend much time together as i was volunteering at distortion while he was here.
Met him later on for a hug shortly at Roskilde festival. : D

text: I met frederik when me and my gf hosted him in Hvidovre (last minute). he needed a couch for his stay during the Distortion festival. He is a kind and funny guy. He loves to party and is kind to people. I hope you enjoyed your stay and your always welcome.

text: We stayed in Frederics house one night. We came late, but he showed us night city and told about main places. He was friendly and kind with us) We spoke much about all 😀. He is positive guy 🤗. I definitely recommend 😉

Frederik is just an awesome guy. Although my stay was shorter than planned we still had time to talk and hang out. We also had a very nice meal with his flatmates which are also great, this house is like family!
See you soon my friend!

Amazing guy, saved us at the last minute. Provided us with a warm welcome and great hospitality throughout our whole stay. And he's really cool, fun to talk with. Would definitely love to visit someday again
Really good host! He's kind, helpfull and knowledge, if you like to discover and talk about music go to his home! Really enjoy with him
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Saint-Nazaire, Pays de la Loire, France

text:
I had a very nice stayover at Frederik's place! It was fun talking with him, he has a huge knowledge about music. I really enjoyed it  :-) And he makes the best spaghetti I've ever eaten!! :-) These alone are a worth a visit. ;-) 
Thank you so much for making place in your wonderful apartment. :-)
It was really nice, we talked about music (obviously :) ) and we shared about travelling experiences !

Rasmus took me in kind of spontaneously because my travel plans changed, real life saver. Since we both had plans we didn't really see each other much but I had a good stay at his place. Very friendly and easy going! Thank you for having me!

Rasmus was a great host. He hosted me for two nights in Aarhus and he helped me to print my boarding card for my plane and he paid through his account on application for my ride from Aarhus to Billund airport. He is very friendly. I recommend staying with him!

Carsten stayed with me for a few days... sadly i was sick allmost all the time 😣 so i couldnt be the most outgoing host ever 😁 
We did go to Amsterdam 1day. Had a crazy dinner with a group of my friends. And had some walks in my city Zwolle. 
Glad we tot the chance to see eachother again! You are a great guy 😊

Meeting Carsten was a wonderful experience. I had so much fun with him during my 3 night stay. He is such an easy going, relaxed and comfortable person to be around. He’s very knowledgeable and fun to chat to! I felt completely at ease and at home staying with him in his lovely apartment in Aarhus. 
We spent some great time together cooking, chatting, watching movies and going to yoga together. I always felt welcomed and easy in his company. If you ever get the chance to be hosted by this lovely person, you won’t be disappointed! 

Looking forward to seeing you again Carsten, whether in Berlin or Aarhus!

I crashed Carsten's couch for one night on my way from Oslo to CPH. Carsten is super friendly, absolutely easygoing-minded and also talkative. He showed me exciting spots in Aarhus I would have probably missed when I have just gone by myself. We had also traditional danish food, which I really enjoyed. I'm really looking forward to see you again in Aarhus, in Basel or somewhere in the world! Take care and thank you for everything!
Stay with Carsten was super. He gave us a city tour. It was amazing. He showed us lovely places in Aarhus which are not in Guide. I absolutely recommend this guy. :)

Me and my friend Emilie came to Århus for the Northside music festival and was so lucky to get to stay with Carsten and hang out with him at the festival. We had so much fun and wished we could have stayed longer! Carsten is a smart, cool and incredibly kind and helpful guy who put up with our general weirdness with a great smile :) And he made us the best coffee I've had in a long time. Hopefully we'll meet again some day :)
Very kind with me for my first expérience after a big day for me! I recommande Carsten

I had a really great time, when I stayed at Carsten's home. He was very open and easy to talk to. We had long conversations and I really enjoyed all of the knowledge that he has. I would def. recommend hanging out with Carsten and would do it again. He is a really cool guy :)  Good day to you, Carsten!
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Svendborg, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark

text: Best. Host. Ever. We had a really great time together, Carsten showed us around and even booked a time-slot for the washing machine when we arrived. (We we're traveling by bike.) To us, he really is a hilarious guy who we always would want to see again. Hugs and thank you A LOT. <3 Kristina and Sophia
Carsten is very nice, knowledgeable person, polite, talkative and positive! I hope we will meet each other soon :)! Cheers!

I really felt at home at Carstens place. He is easy to talk with, funny, down-to-earth and openminded. I enjoyed our good conversations and the relaxed atmosphere. Much appreciated - highly recommended:)

Carsten is the best! BUTT when he had to work...  his friend John was great company too :) I want to see you 2 again verry soon! 
How about tomorrow?!
We had the best conversations, laughed a lot, compared our countries and languages,  shared our thoughts about a lot of stuff, watched stupid Movie clips, play music...we had great couchsessions ;)

See you SOON!

Carsten is the perfect host if you want to have interesting and funny conversations and a well-designed, clean and central-located  home. We stayed one night at his place and enjoyed the apartment and the time with Carsten very much! Please pass by in Goettingen whenever you are there :-)

The last stop on my 4 weeks Denmark-Pilgrimage was Aarhus. Because I sent the couchsurfing requests quite late, I didn't expect to find a host in time. So I was very happy as Carsten replied my request in such a friendly way. He picked me up from the trainstation and showed me around the city. Now I know some awesome "insider-places". We just had a great time in town. 
His appartment is cozy and very well desgined. There we had nice chats, cooked together way too many noodles ;) and listening to great metal music. 
So Carsten is a very very helpful, pleasant and inspiring person and he radiats calmness a lot (maybe thats because he loves Yoga :D ).

So thanks again Carsten for hosting me in such a lovely way. You made my 4-weeks-Pilgrimage complete :)

A friend and I stayed at Carstens place for one night. It was our last stop of our four week trip. We arrived late, but it wasn't a problem for Carsten at all. He even picked us up at the train station. After that he showed us around in Aarhus. It was a lot of fun to hangout with him and we have been to areas, which we would have never explored by ourselves. In the morning he had to leave before us, but it was no problem for him to let us stay at his place. 

It was a great stay and Carsten is an amazing host. 

I hope we will see each other again and of course you are always welcome in Germany!

We stayed with Carsten for only one night but we would do it definitly again. He waited for us at the central station and showed us cool places in Århus. It was interesting to talk with him and to see what he likes about the city.
Even though he had to get early he let us sleep. So thank you for the great time!

It was my first couchsurfing experience ,which I had with Carsten. And I am totally glad about that. 
He met me right after work and showed me special places all over Aarhus ,which I wouldn't have seen without him. 
Also we could talk for hours about everything ,which came up to our minds.
Carsten is an openminded person,very friendly and spending time with him is just feeling comfortable all the time. 
I can definitly recommend him as a Host! 
Because staying with him wasn't just meeting a host,but meeting a potential friend. 
Everything I've expected before,became in the end much more better as I thought.

Please be kind to this genuinely friendly, starting member of CouchSurfing. He offered not only a comfortable place to stay, but also consideration and understanding for the long trips and my need for rest and planning time when I arrived. He was also very helpful in figuring out how to get the ferry. It was very nice to cook for him and eat together, hear about his hobbies and talk about CouchSurfing. In spite of my relatively short stay in Aarhus with him, I would highly recommend him as a host and am confident that he will make equally nice a guest. :)

What more could a scruffy traveler wish for than a warm house, readily available tea and a host who goes out of his way to be a wonderful tour guide and friend :). Staying with Alex was a huge highlight of my time in Denmark, not only is he a thoughtful and fun person but one who travels with an open mind and is always up for the adventure! If you get a chance to host or stay with him along the way I would 1000% recommend! Thank you, thank you, thank you Alex! See you back in New Zealand 🇳🇿
Great host, great location- also gave personnel reference by mistake instead of here- see detail there please😀

Chris accepted our last minute request, for a 1 night in Aarhus. Chris was very thoughtful. He took good care of us and organised his friend who dropped us the key. Even if we didn't hang out (because I was a little bit tired) it was very nice to stay at his place. Thank you Chris!

Chris was very responsive when requested the stay and accepted my last minute request straight away. He picked me up from the station and on the way back to his home pointed out the main attractions and must see locations. Also he was extremely friendly and helpful in all ways! Lent me his bike to use and even gave me a lift when I was on my way. I’m so grateful there are still people like Chris exists :) Thank you 🙏🏽
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Bournemouth, England, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

text:
Chris was a great host! We felt very comfortable with him and in his home. He picked us up at the Bus station and even lent us his bike. He showed us the city and told us what would be worth to see and to do. 
Chris allowed us to cook and wash in his appartment. 
From the Appartment you walk about 10 minutes to the inner city. 
We went out to eat with him on our second evening. 
We would definitly stay with Chris again. Thank you for the great time in Århus!

I'm very grateful to Chris for accepting my last minute request to stay with him. He very kindly picked me up from the train station when I arrived and made sure to point out places I could be interested in going to on the way to his flat. He also insisted that I use his bike during my stay, which made moving around Aarhus so much easier. Conversations with him are never boring and he has great taste when it comes to recommending places to visit as well as places to eat/have a coffee in. His flat is very clean and his couch turns into  a really comfortable bed, so absolutely no complaints there either! The morning cup of coffee was also greatly appreciated :) 
Thank you Chris for everything - let me know if you ever decide to come to Scotland or Spain!
These three girls are lovely and friendly. Despite not being able to convert them to liking whisky, they're clever, thoughtful and fun to be around. Maybe I'll see them in Denmark one day!

text:
Karen Margrethe is so friendly, thoughtful and knowledgeable! We arrived in Aarhus and the first thing she did was to show us all of the sights on a map and told us a lot about the background and history of some of the buildings. We were very well prepared to explore the city! Furthermore, she is so easy going and easy to talk to. You will feel welcome at her place the minute you get there - and you can have a lot of fun with her of if you are a fan of fantasy stories! Some hosts make your stay a lot more worthy and Karen definitely is one of this sort! 
Thank you again for everything, Karen Margrethe!

Karen is really nice person. She picked me up from the train station. And she showed me the city. How amazing time that was. And at the night we talked a lot it was also warm and thoughtful time with her. She is absolutely good host and now she is my good friend. Thanks Karen. I already miss her place❤️

I had a great time staying with Karen. She was really friendly, helped me figure out what to do each day, and respected my space and privacy. Her place is lovely, in a great location, with great space. She also spent time with me showing me some great sites, making my stay even more enjoyable. 

Thanks for giving me a great first couchsurfing experience.
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: London, England, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

text:
It was lovely to stay with Karen, the first person we met in Aarhus. She picked us up at the station when we arrived. She showed us the city and told us about the history of the main  places. Also, her place is really cozy and confortable, we felt as we were at home. She brought us all we need to find a job, get fun and meet our goals here. 
Thanks a lot for bringing us such a great staying! It was awesome to share our first days in Denmark with you! :)

Karen has an uncanny way of making you feel so comfortable in her home that you feel as if you're just staying with a friend you already knew. She's excellent company, very knowledgeable, and a great help with everything from where to get the cheapest groceries to transportation logistics, etc. She made everything easy and pleasant. I can't wait to return to lovely Aarhus to visit her again.

Karen was the nicest , I love her. She was so nice, she helped me with everything, she made me feel like I was at home.
She is really interesting and talking with her is always nice. Her friends were also super cool. I had a great time with her :)
Her house is really nice and she prepared my room so I had my own privacy, the room  was really nice:) 
I was sick the day I arrived,  but she went with me to the hospital and called the doctor before so I didnt have any problems. She was so helpful. Thanks so much Karen :)
She was the perfect host and she is also a great cook! Love her dinners :)
I hope to see you soon Karen :) you are more than welcome to my place.
:) :) huge hug! <3 <3

text:
Jesus nos recibió a mi y a mi novio, super amigable, respetuoso y bondadoso, nos hizo sentir como en casa y nos llevo por unas buenas tapas y cerveza!
Lucia & Luis

Jesús is a very friendly and educated person, I really enjoyed my stay with him! He reads a lot a seems to know about everything, that is very impressive to me. He welcomed me with an open door and recommended me some nice places to visit. Thank you so much :) You have your house in Germany whenever you want.

Jesús es una persona súper amable y cercana, desde la primera vez que hablamos sentí como si nos conociéramos de antes. Encarna al perfecto mexicano: todo corazón. Nos sentimos muy muy agusto con él, siento que he ganado un amigo. Muchas gracias x todo Jesús, y gracias por ser como eres. En Sevilla te espero!

Jesús fue un buen anfitrión, un chico tranquilo y responsable. Nos quedamos un par de días en su casa y fue muy amable y comprensivo con nuestro cambio de itinerario, lamentablemente compartimos muy poco debido a su horario de trabajo pero estuvo bien.
Jesus fue un excelente anfitrión.! Súper recomendado , es una excelente persona. Muy atenta con nosotras. Nos llevó a conocer Madrid y su cultura. Espero que vengas a Colombia

Jesus is very nice, polite, helpful and open-minded guy. We were having really nice conversations on interesting topics and we shared our experiences in many fields -he has a really huge knowledge and it was really interesting to listen to him. He is a perfect host, I couldn't imagine to have a better one in Madrid 😊 He helped me a lot during my stay, gave me some usefull tips and made me feel myself home. I was feeling like a princess having my own room, his flat is very good located and clean. 
Thank you for everything, I wish you all the best and remember you are always welcomed in Heidelberg !
Muy atento para recogerme a pesar del cambio  de horario, y con la suerte del buen clima me acompañó a recorrer la ciudad y hasta me ayudó con unas compras, muy muy muy atento :D

Jesus es una gran persona! Súper caballero, la verdad es que tuve suerte de encontrarlo. 
Sensible y amable, inteligente y trabajador, tuvimos buenas charlas, compartimos vinos y me llevó a lugares súper bonitos en madrid!! 
Le gusta tener todo súper limpio y ordenado y eso es genial. 
Muchas gracias por todo una vez más! Espero verte de nuevo 😊

Jesus is totally friendly and kind person. Really thankful for everything! His house is in 3 min from metro station and not far away from city center. Jesus gave me an extra keys from his flat, so I could come and go whenever I want. Also we had a nice conversations about our countries and had a lot of fun.
So if you are looking for a host in Madrid, I definitely recommend you to stay with Jesus. 
 
Muchas gracias por todo, Jesús!
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Saint Petersburg, Saint Petersburg, Russian Federation

text: Jesús,  was such a great host. I felt like I was staying with family while I was with him. I had my own room and he was kind enough to give me the keys to his place so I can come in out, which I thanked him and appreciated his generosity. We had a lot of fun conversation while we hung out in house and he is very Knowle gable and educated so our conversation were very interesting. If you have the honor of getting hosted by him, you will be in great hands by such a friendly, respectful, educated gentleman. Jesús,  your more than welcomed to come and visit me as long as you like. I just hope I can better a better host than you.... saludos
Fué realmente buena mi experiencia de quedarme con Jesús, me sentí como en casa, el departamento está muy agradable y él súper atento!
Jesus fue muy buen host con nosotras! Nos llevo a conocer el centro y a comer churros en Madrid! Ademas nos trato muy bien todo el tiempo 😊 nos vemos!

Compartí un rato con Jesús en mi estadía en Madrid. Me mostró bonitos lugares para comer y tomar algo en el centro de la ciudad. Hablamos bastante. Jesús es una persona amable y muy inteligente. No me pude quedar en su casa porque tenía una reserva de hostel. Pero me hubiera gustado.
Jesus is very very hospitable and friendly:) I would definitely visit him again

Jesus nicely offered a room in his appartment for me. He was incredibly flexible, his place is clean and he lives very closed to metro station so its easy to head to centro.  We had a nice talk in the beginning and  sadly we couldn't hang much since I was out almost all day visiting places while he was busy with his bio practices, but I would definitely recommend his company and place to stay :) He will always be welcome in my hometown as well.

Jesús es muy amable, respetuoso, divertido  e interesante! de esos que da gusto salir a compartir una cena y charlar de la vida, y asi hacer el intercambio de couchsurfing. Nuestra estadia con el fue perfecta y le estamos muy muy agradecidos!! Sin dudas 100 % recomendable! Lo esperamos por Bariloche en Patagonia Argentina! Cariños! Yai y Agus.
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: San Carlos de Bariloche, Rio Negro, Argentina

text:
Jesús es muy amigable y tranquilo
Tiene experiencia en alojar personas de todo el mundo. Lo recomiendo!
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Buenos Aires, Autonomous City of Buenos Aires, Argentina

text: Super accesible y amigable, muy buena persona. Su casa está impecable y muy cerca del metro al centro.

Jesus is a very very nice guy! He was extremely kind and helpful with us. He gave us tips of the city, a nice place to crash was willing to hang out with us, we could even grab a drink and a few snacks together. And even he is very busy with his work, he always found time for a good conversation and a good time while we were at his home. We talked about a lot of things and he seemed very intelligent, open minded and cool. Thank you so much for your help Jesus. Any time you're in Brazil, let me know! I would love to meet you again... All the best!

Hi ! This two people are amazing !!! They are really friendly and do all what they can for you... I have past​ 2 nights in their flat, and with them ! We are take a beers in the night and go to the festival of the city to :D 
Thanks à lot for everything !!! You can trust on this two people, they are very nicely ! And you are welcome in my house when you want :D
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Sérigné, Pays de la Loire, France

text:
Jesus and his girldfriend was a funny host for me. They waiting for me with a Mexican traditional food and his friends. Talk with they about a lot of interesting things..
Was a perfect experience!
See you in València ;)

I had a wonderful couple of days with Jesus and Emese. They were welcoming, friendly and are wonderful people. I'm so glad I got to meet you both! It was great to spend a couple of days speaking Spanish and get good recommendations on things to do in Szeged. It was great to go out for a traditional Hungarian goulash served in bread and to learn more about Mexico. I hope our paths will cross again :)

Jesus is very cool guy. He is interesting,  he makes our planet better and it's not just an empty sound. He is very nice and kind to us. When you are in his house you feel very good.
In the morning he offered us a very delicious potato soup and coffee and me and my bf understood that we didn't want to leave him!
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: St Petersburg, St Petersburg, Russian Federation

text: Jesús and Emese are warm, kind and generous, they are just amazing hosts and a lovely couple. My nephew and I had a great time with them, chatting, having beers, and soaking in Anna Fürdő bath. Thanks to them, I have tried a Mexican dish of which I haven't heard before, not to mention that I got to practice both Spanish and Hungarian:-) In fact, thanks to Emese and her help with my Hungarian homework i didn't fail my final exam:-) Emese and Jesús were very welcoming and trusting, they really made us feel at home at their amazing flat. It was a pleasure indeed to get to know, albeit briefly, these lovely people, and I trust our paths will cross again. In the meantime, all the best and thank you very much indeed!

Jesus and his girlfriend are simply amazing! That kind of people that want help you widouth any expectation, and that do their best to make you feel confortable. I was supposed to stay in their cute and cleen apartment for one night, but finally I decided to stay one night more. We talked about the cultures in our different countries and I even learned how to prepare a mexican piñata. I definitely recommand to stay in their place or at least to hang out if you pass trough Szeget! I will be glad to come again or to host you in Trieste if you pass trough it :)
Jesus and emese are lovely, lovely people. Felt immediately at home and comfortable.  They are generous, knowledgeable people, and I would be proud to call the my my friends.

Jesus and Emese are absolutely awesome hosts! They are very kind hearted and genuine people and it was a pleasure to stay in their household. They left me some great tips about where to visit in Szeged and they introduced me to their favorite university pub place. It was an absolute pleasure meeting these two, exchanging stories and travel experiences. Thank you guys for making my time in Szeged such a good experience, I hope to see you soon!

Jesus and his girlfriend "émeché" ( ;) ) hosted us 2 nights instead of one! They both are really nice and friendly , we really felt at home  ! They brought us to the restaurant were we had the best goulash ever and we really felt comfortable with them!  You can feel that they are really happy to host and meat people! We are glad to be in their guest photo album :D

I wrote in Jesús's personal references, instead of guest references, but it all comes down to the fact that he is a great host and a lovely guy. Hope to come back to Szeged or to host you in return sometime!

La Meche y Jesús son excelentes personas,me siento muy orgulloso de haber sido su primer surfer viviendo como pareja, mi estadía en su casa fue espectacular, tienen buen sentido del humor, tomamos unas cervezas, caminamos por centro, en fin muchas cosas bonitas Viví con esta súper pareja, le agradezco mucho por darme hospedaje en su casa chicos, también recuerden que cuando vayan a Colombia tienen una casa donde llegar, los espero, saludos.
Meche and Jesus are excellent people, I feel very proud to have been his first surfer living as a couple, my stay at home was spectacular, have good sense of humor, had a few beers, we walked downtown, in so many beautiful things Viví with this super couple, thank you very much for giving me lodging in your boys home, also remember that when they go to Colombia have a house to come, I hope, greetings.
We stayed with Jesus for 1 night. We came in the evening and had to leave the next morning quiet early again. Jesus took us out for dinner, was uncomplicated and was very nice to us. Thanks!

I moved to his friends' place the second night in szeged, as he had more surfers coming and his friends are so lovely girls. 
hope you enjoy your life in Europe.
