text: Jesus is a really nice person and he hosted me with four of my friends! I couldn't hope for a better host :)
response: {'id': '13807982', 'text': 'It was a really nice experience :)', 'createdDate': '2013-09-03T15:01:48Z', 'experience': 'positive', 'relationshipType': 'host', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '4423225'}, 'from': {'id': '1995540', 'publicName': 'Jesus Montiel', 'publicAddress': {'id': '4700662', 'description': 'Aarhus, Central Denmark Region, Denmark'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/ht-images.couchsurfing.com/u/1995540/fc6fd9f4-3b88-4432-aeca-3df12bd42a81', 'status': 'maybe', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

text: Mads' stay was great. We couldn't hang out as much as we would have liked, because unfortunately I got ill... Nevertheless I got this strange feeling, as if we have known each other from before... or more, precisely, as if we have had a bunch of shared experiences together in the past, a common ground or something. So the moments we did spend together had this special density that made them great. Also, he met some of my friends here and in a way I feel I unfolded myself in them, so we shared more than the actual time we shared... Hope we see each other again and keep finding this metaphysical ways of relating to each other!

Mads is very helpful nice host!! 
he will play his fantastic music i enjoy it! 
first day he cooked a fantastic meal for me:)) and also the great breakfast i like that smooth:)!! 
and my last day i need to be very early to leave he is sooo nice wake up that early and drive me to the place;)
Prepare for kitchen takeover! ^^ Dani and Tim stayed for three nights and we had a great time. They have been very funny, open minded and cooked for us every day. I would definitely host them again.

Dani & Tim we’re great guests. They have become experts at surfing. They are very eager to cook and share food and conversation. They are full of cost saving travel tips and have really seen a lot on a disciplined budget. I hope to see them again! Thanks for the laughs and tuning my guitar! “Mr. Joe”.

Dani and Tim. I feel so much fulfilled by their visit. I found an angels and siblings in them. In three days they tought me a lot about a world and a love and the love in the world. The minute they crossed the threshold all goods were shared same as all the work, food and joy. I experienced a good working social unit, where everyone feels responsible for themselves, for things, needs and wants of others. 
Merger
Flow
Fusion

I’m so happy I got the chance to spend time with Dani and Tim! They’re both awesome people, pretty laidback and fun :) after some pretty busy days we spent some amazing chill time together, plus they cooked up some vegan magic in my kitchen two times and it was definitely a pleasure to share some (very delicious) meals and conversations with them! I truly hope we’ll see each other somewhere in the world again sometime soon! Don’t miss out on the chance of meeting and hosting them •

Dani and Tim are wonderful and awesome people!!! We really liked to be with them!:)
They are very friendly,reliable and courteous people with kindness, great mix of intelligence, curiosity and fun:)
We really enjoyed to host them in our home. Thanks for the four amazing days when we could discussing about many topics and knowledge.
Thanks guys for the wonderful vegetarian goulash and the special Mate Tee!!!:) It was a great experience together :)
And special thanks to the unforgettable guitar play Tim!!!! 
We really enjoyed!!!
We are grateful to meet you and meet such wonderful people as you are.
We would like to highly recommend Dani and Tim as a very good member of CS:)

To have Dani & Tim at my/our place was a pure pleasure. Interesting heart and head involved talks but also relaxed at right times. :)  cooking, sport and the talks. Also thank you for sharing plenty of your travel wisdom

Really enjoyed hosting Dani and Tim and spending some quality time with them.
Together we visited Brasov's Old city  center, Peles Castle and went to a 
guitar concert together, called "acoustic vibes".
We cooked together (actually they mostly did it :)) some vegetarian lasagna 
which was very delicious. Other interesting recipes followed the next days, including 
curry with rice and tofu with eggplants...yumm ;)
It was also very nice to hear about their traveling experience from Asia 
and about the landscapes and culture from New Zealand. I hope to visit some day :)
Thanks guys, you are welcome back anytime!
Wonderful experience! Amaizing people! Thank you as many stars se saw on the sky :) was a clear sky last night! Even words are not enough to describe this experience!
column18: {'text': 'I already miss falling asleep gazing at the stars,  for sure :) Love <3', 'author': {'id': '2401543', 'publicName': 'Dani Goffi', 'publicAddress': {'id': '5106665', 'description': 'Brabrand, Aarhus Municipality, Denmark'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/images.couchsurfing.us/G4GGC3U/13774765_l_33e54f2ffb642ff862b64aa24a0bb6ff.jpg', 'status': 'maybe', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'createdDate': '2018-04-21T07:34:45Z'}

text:
I hosted Dani and Tim for 3 nights and I enjoyed having them over. They love cooking so i was lucky to try some spicy veggies and delicious chickpea curry 😋.
They have traveled a lot, so it's hard to run out of topics to talk about 😀.
I'm glad i could offer them a place to rest and relax, though i wasn't around much to hang out. Next time hopefully i have more time to spend with these lovely world travelers 😀.

Dani and Tim, the world in our house
What could be the gift for a person who desire to go around the world? I tell you guys: Dani and Tim! Two young globetrotters at your home is the best lesson that you can have if you want emulate them. And especially with Dani and Tim in your house you'll have the honor to be a little part of their long travel around the world. Every information, story, tips, anecdotes you want to hear Dani and Tim will tell you. 
I and Enrico, my husband, have tryed to give at our guests a good hospitality in spite of our little free time. In the evening, when we got back from work, it was very nice to be expected by Daniela and Timothy with dinner prepared, and not any kind of food but delicious dishes from the world. 
We wish you guys a good travel and we are sure to see you again.
PS: Megan asked us a mat to make yoga! :-)

What can I say? After some months not hosting I started again with Tim and Dani, a couple that sent me also a request some times ago. The first time I was not able to host them, but now yes and I’m just complaining that it was so short their stay. Very knowledgeable people, we shared a dinner and a couple of tea cups talking about different topics. The day after they left very early leaving the room in perfect condition. It makes the difference when you host experienced CSurfers :)

I hosted Dani and her husband Tim for three nights and everything was just perfect!

We spent a lot of time together so we had very interesting conversations. They cooked some Asian food (they have been travelling for 15 months around Asia so they know how to do it) at home and even I could invite a couple of friends and have a good time all together. I must say the food was awesome! We also walked a lot around Milano enjoying my favourite places of the city with them. 

Dani is a super happy, funny and positive person full of energy. She is very considerate, wise, talkative… and much more of good adjectives. And she is super clean! The kitchen was all time tidy and clean, even more than when she came! 

Tim also shares all these positive adjectives so I’m not going to repeat them, I will just say: Give him a guitar and enjoy!

Concluding, hosting people at home and taking care of them is a bit tiring, but when you find people like Dani and Tim it fully deserves! You learn about their experiences, philosophy of life, knowledge… I like CS because it helps me to grow as a person, and this is thanks to people like them. So thank you! :)

I wish you the best and I really hope to see you again in a future! ;)
Un abrazo muy fuerte,
Santi
Gente muy guay con mucho para hablar y pasar un buen rato. Y cocinan de puta madre. Así que muy recomendables!

Dani and Tim stayed a couple days at my place and it was a pleasure to have them around. We chat a lot about many interesting topics, they cooked a really nice dinner, we watched a film together... Just great people that you don't want to miss while they're around the world :)

All the best with your time in Argentina and I hope to go to New Zealand to help you out in your future project!
Adrian

Dani and Tim stayed at our place for few nights and it was good fun to have them. 
Since they are professional travellers they're full of stories to share and it was even more fan since we have lived quite similar experiences.
It was cool to go to do some voleyball and tennis and over all share some good meals at home.
See you around the world guys.
Take care!

Dani and Tim rank among the funniest couchsurfers we've had so far :-).  We really enjoyed the time spent together despite the illness of some of us ;-).  They shared some incredibly crazy stories from their travels with us, prepared a delicious spinach quiche and always did the washing up which we really appreciated :D. They are hilarious people and  great to hang out with. If you have the chance to meet them, don't hesitate and definitely go for it! You won't get bored with this lovely couple. Hope to see you again somewhere on the Earth!

¡Encantadora!

Ha sido un placer teneros por casa y compartir dos días juntos, ¡a pesar que no os haya dejado dormir mucho! jeje

Dani es una chica super simpática que muestra mucho interés en todo lo que le explicas, preguntado continuamente por la gastronomía, la naturaleza, viajes,....¡así da gusto hacer de guía!

¡Os deseo lo mejor en vuestro próximo viaje cruzando el charco!

¡Besos y estamos en contacto!

Dani and her boyfriend are experienced travelers and CS. There were very good guests. We were able to share meals and good conversations with great exchanges of experiences. Your travel stories, your perceptions of places are great. I hope to find them again. They will be warmly welcomed in my house.

Hola!! :) Dani and Tim is a amazing couple! they are open mind, We had funny conversation was really cool moment!
They made amazing dinner was delicious!!!
Thanks for your all advice. 
(Rodrigo) Thanks for my first té.
We really recommend Dani and Tim.   We hope see you soon.

Dani and Tim!!! Two nice and positive guys, with the real Couchsurfing spirit!
During their stay, my flat was filled with fun, enthusiasm and joy! 
They shared with me food, music, conversations (sometimes funny, sometimes thoughtful and inspiring) and, of course, a lot of travel stories. Their journey across the world is amazing and inspiring, and the spirit with which they are doing it very positive.
If you have the chance to meet or host them, don't miss it!
Good luck for your future, and hope to see you again :)
Un abrazo!

Dani and Tim are the sweetest couple ever. They are easygoing, ready to help and collaborate at home. 
They even cook a wonderful dinner their last night. Thanks for your visit guys. You have a home wherever I will be.
Good luck with your adventure!!!
Alf

I had a very good time with Dani and her friend Tim. A lot if interesting and funny discussions . They were curious about discovering Marseille together. They are really experienced travellers and couchsurfers and I appreciated it. I hope they will come back !

Ciao Dani! ciao Tim! I enjoyed so much your presence in my house and my life for those three days. You have been so nice & kind that I almost felt I was the guest! always cooking and sharing, always cheerful. and I'm also glad that you proved to be open enough to accept an unanticipated additional CSer! it was nice! have a great trip and be back whenever you want! Ariela is waiting for your greetings (she was sleeping on the bedroom window when you left...)

Dani and Tim are just an amazing couple! They are both fun and have a nice attitude towards life. It was really nice to share my experience and a bit of my life with them, and get a peak at their enviable roaming life! Hope to see them again

Dani is gorgeous, powerful, with a huge smile, talkative and interesting, full of energy and strength! She and Tim are a great couple who can serve as an example and add a nice lovely touch to the place. They are both flexible, relaxed and enjoying life and harmony! It was a great pleasure having them as my guests, observing their kind communication and seeing what a great tandem they are! This was the first time I host a couple in a long-lasting relationship and it is a wonderful experience! Good luck, guys! Wish you all the very best!

We really enjoyed hosting Dani and Tim! They are super easy going, have interesting travel stories, and they cook great vegetarian food :) See you again in Denmark, or wherever you live in the future!

Oooohhh sooo good
I want lissen more storys from you. 
I hope we meet again maybe in NZ if you founding an ökological village. 
You inspire me. You both are an amazing couple. 
That four days were very beautifull and gread. 
Fasnacht, Räpli, Fire and good meals. 
Perfect

Dani, Tim and Marcel are wonderful guests and very experienced couchsurfers with tons of entertaining travel- and life stories to share.
Actually they did way more for us than we would ever expect - it was hard to stop Dani from cleaning and helping. ;-)
I can only recommand to host all three of them anytime!

Dani and Tim are very friendly and interesting people.  It was very nice to talk about our travel experience and share some meals. I would definitely host them again, they are trusty and very helpful, they cooked me a delicious breakfast! I would have liked to have more time to hanging out with them. Maybe next time in New Zealand!

Dani and Tim are great and fun company. My new kids in town :-) Just like having family around - great to talk to but we can also do our own stuff.
They are exellent in networking and managed to get involved with so many people in no time. l'm impressed.  
Sure we'll keep in touch.
Dani and Tim were awesome!! Some of the friendliest travelers i have met. Would love to host you guys again. :D See you soon!

I am very grateful to have met and hosted Dani & Tim. They are funny, clever, respectful and caring (among so many other things) and their trip around the world over the past 16 months is inspiring and truly amazing. Hope you find a good job here in Denmark and that we meet again. Greetings from me and the boys - and thanks for cleaning up so thoroughly after yourselves before leaving :D
column18: {'text': '<3 <3 Thank you! See you soon :)', 'author': {'id': '2401543', 'publicName': 'Dani Goffi', 'publicAddress': {'id': '5106665', 'description': 'Brabrand, Aarhus Municipality, Denmark'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/images.couchsurfing.us/G4GGC3U/13774765_l_33e54f2ffb642ff862b64aa24a0bb6ff.jpg', 'status': 'maybe', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'createdDate': '2016-08-31T08:03:25Z'}

text:
So far in my hosting experience she is the best surfer!! Wonder why?! Tim&Dani are the ones in who company you feel comfortable from the very beginning! Warm, kind, honest, flexible with no high desires. They will make you laugh while telling their travel stories, cook the best vegetarian lazania from the things they'll find in your fridge(really, guys! Still remember that taste!) Tim might play some songs with the guitar while Dani is cleaning your kitchen, they'll make you feel like you're the surfer, not a host! :) Sending some more smiles from Lithuania!
Good luck :)

It's always hard to figure out what to write here. So I will be short this time - I totally enjoyed Dani's and Tim's stay here! Talks, watching the football (althought don't like the result), travel stories, attitude and so on, and so on... Definately hope to see them again some day, somewhere!

Dani and her boyfriend surfed our couch for two nights during their long trip around the world. They were super-easygoing, fun and ready to share their interesting experiences.
We spent some good time eating together (they prepared just amazing veggie-burgers!), watching the latest Game of Thrones episode and taking  a walk.
Hope you will enjoy the rest of your trip and will have many others in the future! Maybe we'll see you in Denmark at some point!
Dani and Tim were so very kind and fun! I'm really glad I got to meet them and would happily host them again anytime!!

We Hosted Dani and Tim during their visit in Helsinki. They both are very nice and  easygoing and we enjoyed spending  time with them. It was wonderful  to listen their stories about their great adventure. They cooked delicious food for us and taught about their home countries and much more. Those two days went too fast, it would have been great to spent more time with this lovely couple! Hopefully we will meet again.

It was a lot of fun hosting Dani and her partner Timothy in Busan, Korea for a few days.  They're both very active and independent travelers, and we had a blast hiking and playing badminton as well as hanging out around the apartment watching movies and eating some home-cooked food.  They're both ideal couchsurfers in so many ways.... friendly, social, clean, etc.  I really enjoyed hearing about their extensive travels so far and look forward to keeping in touch and hearing even more tales down the road.  Take care and happy travels you two!!

Dani and her husband Tim stayed at my place for 1 night. Actually they were supposed to stay for 2 nights, but they found it's impossible considering their flight ticket. I was busy for my business trip but I could spend some time to chat with them. They were experienced travelers and communications were very nice. Hope to meet you again, Dani!

Dani and Tim make me happy during their stay. Dani is very lively person, so I got a lot of energy from her whenever we chat. Tim is good at making great foods and playing guitar. I already miss his cooking and music. They always tried to share their time with me and my son. It was so memorable time for us. I definitely recommend you to meet Dani and Tim. They will make you smile. :)
Dani and Tim were great guests. They are a perfect example of why we do couchsurfing. They are always welcome back here.

Dani and Tim were amazing guests.  They cooked an amazing dinner while they stayed with me.  Tacos.  And boy did I miss Mexican food. They have such warm personalities! They are quick with a smile or a laugh and they are always asking if you need a hand. They are very gracious, even when I feel like all I am doing is talking.  Its so great when such gracious people walk into your life.  I hope our paths cross again.
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: san diego, ca, United States of America

text: This guys are amaizing,we spend a great time together,they are travel for a long time and have a very adventure's life.We are very happy to meet they!!!!Dany ya sabes mi casa es tu casa!!!!

Dani is a sharp gal who really understands couchsurfing. Really i should be thanking her, because with her and her husband came some wonderful weather, and a wonderful atmosphere in my tiny apartment. Music, books, darts, beers, roofs, coffees, and one of the best damn vegan burgers i've ever had the pleasure of eating. In Guilin, my apartment is crappy and small so it always works better if we just pretend that we've been friends forever, and rarely has it been as easy as with Dani.
Hasta luego, y Gracias!

Oh, Dani and Tim, what a lovely couple! Always with warm smiles on their faces, full of positive energy, and without doubt wonderful companies! They stayed with me for three days, very polite and humorous, had no problems getting around my flat, by which I mean they've made my kitchen comes back alive,  they are the very first surfers who fixed delicious meals for me despite the lack of proper utensils for making western food. We had quite a lot of intriguing conversations, they showed me nice photos and videos from their trip, and we had a cozy movie night like old friends in the last day! :-) Just like Tim said, I think they kinda belong to the city, and I do wish everything would work out, and they could make back to Chengdu this year. Please don't even bear the second thought in hosting or staying with them. When you guys are back, it's my turn to be the chef! Take care, a big hug! :-)

Daniela and his husband are nice and easygoing, they arrived my house smartly. And they cooked Thai food to my friends, I'm so jealous that I miss the dinner twice. When I'm sick in the bed and I make a video call to my girlfriend, I feel the warm atmosphere when they're at the house. When I looked at their faces, so innocent smile from them and I'm so impressed by their life pursuing happiness. Good luck and welcome back.

What a lovely couple! Thank you for cooking dinner for us and sharing lots of interesting stories about your adventure. I will save the ideas you showed to me and hope one day you will come back here, enjoy coffee and how the things change.
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Hội An, Quang Nam Province, Vietnam

text: Tim and Dani positive and cheerful people, open and sociable. It was nice practice English with them. They created lightness and ease, joy and fun an atmosphere in our home. They enjoys playing with our kid, we were treated to a delicious meal and told interesting stories about his journey. We are grateful for the cheerful company, and will be glad to see them again.

Dani and Tim stayed with us for 3 nights, and it was amazing. They spoiled me so bad  - cooked great food twice a day, washed dishes and played with my kid. I was like a guest of a well serviced hostel, but I was the HOST!

They are pro travelers, never bothered me anything and take care of themselves (and us too) more than perfect. They brought joy and big smiles to our home. Thank you very much for staying with us!

Enjoy your trip! and I really wish to see you again ;)))))
Daniela and Tim are good guests and easy to talk with. I wish to meet them again.

text:
Having Dani and Tim at home meant coming home from a long day's work to be greeted with a whiff of delicious food cooking. 
When Dani asked me what I didn't like eating, all I could think of was raw fish (ie. Japanese sashimi), I forgot to mention that I don't care very much for onions and bell peppers. So when I watch her throw loads of these in her cooking, I wasn't so sure about dinner, and it was too late to tell her then.  But Dani is such an awesome cook that I loved everything she made, even the onions and bell peppers (which I began to cook with on my own since she's left!). 
Kitchen adventures aside, Dani has also done great stuff with my computer. I don't know what magic she did, but my computer is faster, I have a new windows and she's taught me how to make better use of the kindle reader I have. 
I miss Dani a lot. I got so used to coming home to them, that it does take some adjusting to their absence. 
Continue to have amazing adventures wherever you go and take good care. I hope to see you guys again! :)
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Kuala Lumpur, Wilayah Persekutuan Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
response: {'id': '18295943', 'text': 'Stef is a beautiful and amazing woman. She has a kind nature and giving heart. She allowed us to stay much longer than I ever stayed at a CS so we could recharge our batteries and catch up on work before continuing our long journey, and managed to make us feel comfortable and welcomed all along.  She took us to markets, waterfalls and festivals. text: Meeting Daniela is like a getting a warm hug from a cuddly Chuck-taylor-wearing sheep dog after coming into a hut with a cosy fireplace that is grinning to people on an outside filled with the crisp fresh air, cool spring water and   beautiful bees.
response: {'id': '18131764', 'text': "Avast! Keep yer eyes peeled and yer daughters safe from the beardless and handsome Cap'n Jake, Sailin' out from his pirate haven in Ol' Singapore. Jake makes for fine company, should you happen across him, and can offer the finest lodgings an old sea dog could beg for. Don't be afraid to ask his advice on the local conditions, for Jake has much knowledge to share of his hometown and the world beyond.\r\nMay hopes we cross paths with Ol' Jake again someday, roamin' on the high seas. Farewell until then!", 'createdDate': '2015-09-02T02:14:24Z', 'experience': 'positive', 'relationshipType': 'surf', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '3461956'}, 'from': {'id': '2401543', 'publicName': 'Dani Goffi', 'publicAddress': {'id': '5106665', 'description': 'Brabrand, Aarhus Municipality, Denmark'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/images.couchsurfing.us/G4GGC3U/13774765_l_33e54f2ffb642ff862b64aa24a0bb6ff.jpg', 'status': 'maybe', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

text:
Dani a strong willed lady. She wasn't feeling well when she arrived here in SG but with her determination and seeing through her eyes she was still beaming with hopes that she would managed to go around SG. Indeed, yes, we were able to hike southern ridges. Her smile and enthusiasm remind me that whenever I go I shall bring it. Hope to see you guys again.

P.S. Keep writing/updating your blogs.. :-)
response: {'id': '18131741', 'text': 'Our time with Val and Hanna was wonderful. Not only did they make us feel at home and welcomed, but all their flatmates as well. We explored beautiful Singapore together and enjoyed home made cooking. They are one of the best hosts we have ever had the pleasure to stay with and recommend them to anyone in the community for sure! Thanks again guys and much love. text: Dani and Tim is just a great couple to host! They manage to takecare of themselves very well and I learn a lot about Indonesia from their amazingly rich point of view! See you again one day guys and thanks for cooking the delicious pasta! :)
response: {'id': '17911895', 'text': 'Lukman is a fantastic host! He goes over out of his way to help out travellers, organize activities, and make sure they are comfortable. text:
Dani is an exceptional person. You're hardly bored if living/travelling with her. You wanna have fun, deep conversations, going for trip? Dani is up for everything. Always happy and positive.
So glad i've met her!!!!
response: {'id': '9829753', 'text': 'Marcel is such an amazing person! He is a lot of fun, warm, confident. We were together for quite a while and never ever had an argument or anything like that! text:
I met Dani twice and she became one of the best friends. (it leads towards a question, is she so amazing or am i so desperate? :D)
She can make you relax, laugh, she is inspirative and so i started with joga and my addiction to low quality series :{
I met myself as not a food delinquent though, seeing others (her) constantly eating too!
See you somewhere soon Danielka :*

Dani accepted my super-last minute request and rescued me! :D
Although her partner and she were quite busy and tired, and my arrival wasn't planned at all, they received we warmly, and fed me for dinner with nice vegan food as well as for breakfast.

Home it's a shared spacious, bright and tidy apartment in Brabrand. The area is calm. A bit out of town, but connected with the center with buses, <1h walking distance from most of Aarhus.

Dani is a real backpacker, has a wide CS experience and loves it. You'll find a really good organization and precision. Above all, from the few hours that I shared with these fellows, I remarked how positive and humble they are! :)

Glad that there are stiop real CSers around the globe. Thanks again guys, I really appreciate. Hope our paths will cross again! :)

We had a great stay at Dani's place. Dani received us with a warm welcome and made us feel very much at home. She showed us things from Aarhus and surroundings and cooked us a lovely meal. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay with Dani and her flatmates.

Dani is awesome! She won my stomach... That is heart... That's the same thing, right? Great cook, great person, terrible jokes... That is terrific because we have a similair taste in humor? (Yeah, I liked the jokes. And her laughing) She doesn't feel like a couchsurfer. She feels like a roommate :) Like somebody it feels very natural to stay with. Even if she speaks backwards Latin in her sleep (or it just may be random Spanish? I'll try throwing holly water on her next time).
I enjoyed my time with her and with Tim. And I'd surf their place and let them surf mine any time :)
Much love :*

I missed the hosting reference and put a personal one accidentally :') so this is just twice the statement that you are awesome!

My friend and me stayed with lovely Dani and Tim for three nights in Aarhus and really enjoyed our stay. A warm welcome, relaxed time together and good advice on what to see/get around the city - everything a surfer could wish for! Also, amazing cooks who love to share their food- thanks for everything!
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Newcastle upon Tyne, England, United Kingdom

text:
Dani and Tim were great hosts! We arrived late at night, with an extra traveler, and they didn't hesitate to welcome him in as well (backstory: we met him on the ferry and he offered to give us a ride so we asked Dani if he could stay too). Our beds had already been made and Tim showed us around the flat before wishing us goodnight. The next morning, Tim and Dani made a meal (fantastic broccoli and cheese pasta!) and we had a pleasant talk for about an hour or so. They're both kind, generous- and judging from their stories- adventurous people! 

If you get the chance to stay with or host Dani and Tim, take it! :)

Dani and the Aarhus crew were so great! I had a really short stay in Aarhus, but felt so welcomed into the community there. We shared tea and had genuine conversations, where we also talked about previous and upcoming trips. She cooked the whole household a vegan dinner, gave me a nice couch to sleep on, and best of all, let me borrow a bike to go an an adventure through the fields of Aarhus to a party at a co-op. We got a little lost, but we managed all right. :) What a super fun evening! I wish I didn't have to head back to Copenhagen for work so soon. I hope our paths cross again somewhere in this little-big world. Un Abrazo!

Dani and Tim were gracious hosts; they let me change my dates and double book their surfers to accommodate me. While they both are busy with life, they make an effort to share meals and conversations with their surfers. They were able to provide lots of useful information about travel logistics in Denmark and Europe. I really enjoyed my stay with them and welcome them to my home (when I finally have a home) anytime!
Thank you Dani and Tim!!

Our stay with Danni and her flatmates were simply perfect. Even though they were the hosts of a pot Luck in the evening we were invited to stay and participate. We felt welcome at anytime. "mi casa es zu casa" is not just a phrase for them. 
Lot's of good talks, shared drinks and travel story's!

Dani is a girl full of energy and together with Tim, they are a couple you definitely want to meet, host or to stay with. They both are very smart, caring and tolerant. We enjoyed time spent with them, loved returning to their place and are ready to host them in Europe or wherever else we meet. Good luck on your journey, guys..

text:
Luckily I was persistent when I asked to stay on Dani's couch, as I really wanted to meet Dani & Tim after reading their profiles... also after seeing Dani's golden robot profile pic - too good!

As Dani was playing volleyball down south, I only met her half way through my stay.. which was no probelm at all as Tim was around... all it actually meant was, that it was maybe more intense and funnier for the rest of the time! :) I really enjoyed Dani's company, all the stories she shared about her CS experiences and travels. And after seeing those videos during/after our last dinner together I'd love to have spent some more time around/with Dani & Tim. They seem to be magnets for great times :)

Dani was even so kind to lend me her tent for my 3 week trip around NZ. I was really glad I had it, it opened up a lot of (sleeping) possibilities! :D - Dani, the tent hood is on the way, by post, including extras!

Thank you so much again, you are always welcome at mine!

text: Nice guy. Relaxing guest for a lazy host :) Had fun watching some political comedy together.
Nikolaj was a friendly, quiet and social guy. Impressed by his ability to bike from Oslo to Brønnøysund(860km!!). We had a great time with him, would definitely host him again!
Cool and friendly guy:)
I only talked on the phone with Nikolaj while he was staying in my apartment. Nikolaj seems to be a very Nice and friendly person and I would gladly host him again.
Social and friendly guy. He had some funny stories to tell about his biking trip, and was interesting to talk with.

Nikolaj is a easy going and friendly man. He only spent a night at my place, so we didn't really get to spend that much time together. Went for a 20 min stroll and watched an episode of Fargo and that's it.
All in all a good experience, wold definitely host again.

Nikolaj planned to stay for one night, but after an unfortunate and unlucky collision between him and his bike and a sheep along the road he had to see the doctor and the bike needed some repair. As there were no spare parts in Oppdal Nikolaj stayed an extra day and came with me to Trondheim the next day where he could get to a bike repair shop. Nikolaj is a polite and quiet young man that was nice to talk to and I recommend him for stays with other hosts.
Nice guy, chatted for a few hours before we called it a night. No hustle to hoste him in at all!

Nice guy from Denmark.  Very nice to host him.  Wish him the best of luck with his trip.  
Hope that others will help him on his way up in norh of Norway.
I only hosted Nikolaj for one night, and he arrived quite late in the evening, so we didn't have to much time together. But he was very polite and friendly, and I would gladly host him again.

I am still so glad that Nikolaj - let me stay overnight with him. He is friendly , inteligent and very pottential engineer! I am seriously curious what is he going to develope in the future! Thank you again Nikolaj - Have a good one and good luck! ;-) I am looking forward to meet you again :-)
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Statenice, Central Bohemian Region, Czech Republic

text: Nikolaj was kind to host me at such short notice! It was good to talk about cycling :)
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Eastleigh, England, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

text:
Such a nice person! One of those that make you feel at home... Funny, kind, humble and specially spontaneous! 
Thanks for your time and keep spreading your beautiful laugh! 

Dream Big & Buena Vida!

Rozalia was a friendly, fun and funny host on the night we spent in her place and sorted two sodden cyclists with somewhere to dry our bedraggled possessions. We’d happily have spent a bit more time with her were she not such a diligent student of chemical engineering. Welcome in London any time 👍
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: London, England, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

text: I’ve spent a really great time in Denmark! If you,re looking for host in Aarhus contact with Rosalia she’s the best host. You can talk with her about everything, she will show you a lot of great places in this city. When I was living with her I didn’t felt like a stranger- the atmosphere was so familiar! (She make a really tasty cold coffee c: ) Also I will never forget when we went for running together and then we bought a watermelon  :’)  Rozalia is really interesting, open-minded person, with a good sense of humor. I think that there’s nothing that she can’t do. There’s no words which could describe how thankful I’m for this time in Aarhus.
She is an incredible hostess  ❤️
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Samsø Municipality, Central Denmark Region, Denmark

text:
Morten is a great host. He was very easy-going, attensive and thoughtful. He was really kind to pick me up from the train station and intended to show me the Aarhus library which unfortunately was closed, haha😅.
His family was also super nice and sweet! I felt very welcome right from the first moment. They were so kind to offer me tea and meals. I was given a lot of freedom to do my things in the house and I truly appreciate the trust. Morten was genuinely interested in other cultures which made him really easy and pleasant to talk to. He told me a lot about the Danish culture and I am very grateful to have gained an insight about Denmark from a different perspective.
Although I only stayed with Morten’s family for one night, it was such a great experience that I would gladly repeat. I would definitely recommend Morten both as host and guest. 
Thanks a lot for hosting me, Morten. Best of luck with your future adventure! You know that you got a place in NanNing😏.

I’m so happy that I got a chance to meet this guy. Varun showed me some beautiful places that I couldn’t find easily if I were alone. Also he gave me some useful tips what I could do in the city. Varun is polite and helpful person. I hope I’ll visit Aarhus while staying in Denmark and then we explore the area again! ;-)

i spent a night at varun. he showed me the beautiful city aarhus. we were at the water, in the zoo and had a good time. in the evening we cooked together and watched a film. unfortunately i was very tired but that was no problem for him. the next day he helped me with the train booking - because the machines at the main station did not work. many thanks and all the best for your further plans and the camino,)

What a great guesting experience I had! :)
That's how a host should be: welcoming, friendly, available, humble, polite, selfless, cultivated...

Albeit Varun accepted my really last minute request in few minutes, he was ready to welcome me. Varun's flat is clean and tidy, located in a calm, nice neighborhood close to downtown, stations and beaches.

But what definitely astonished me was how great was our sharing moments. We had the chance to spend some times together and he is so smart, open-minded, engaged in finding his own place in world.
In few minutes he led me to wonderful Rajasthan, preparing a delicious curry rice and projecting a funny Bollywood movie. He left me his home keys, insisted to drop my huge backpack at his place and fed me also the second day with an "IndiaNeapolitan" pasta :D

I got a friend :)

He is the perfect host: cultivated, polite and open-mind person, with a cute (and very Danish) apartment, in a very convenient location. Varun is a positive thinker. Prudence+temperance+ generosity+courage=  All the parameters for define him as “a good person”.
Varun is my family.
I highly recommend him as a host.
Everything was perfect, because Varun is so great and friendly person! Thanks you so much for my Denmark ✨

Varun has a very nice apartment and was a polite host. He cooked a delicious Indian meal for me and gave me good recommendations of what to do in Aarhus and how to get around. Thank you Varun I wish you all the best!

Varun is a wonderful host. He welcomed me at his home, showed me around the city with his bike and brought me to places which I didn't know existed. Varun is a great listener and it was very intereating to share our stories.

Such a great experience with Varun....it was better than i expected before to arrive. The place is lovely, really clean and cozy, but regarding him...i felt like home. He's really friendly, open mind, and the dinner was delicious. We've been on the same mindset, which the communication was great, like knowing each other since always. All the best Varun!!!! My greetings!

Varun!
What a great adventure! I thank you so much again for your valuable time. 
We were biking in the forest, had a great view over the sea from the top of the Moesgaard museum, we grabbed a coffee & an ice together, had a tasy breaktfast in the sun and I will never forget our philosophizing conversations about life in the evenings! :) 
You are so open minded i wish everyone in this small world has the same view of life like you have! 
It was a pleasure to stay in your beautiful apartment, which is so close to the city and as well to the beach and forest. (and damn, it was so close to the Justin Bieber concert, haha :D ) 
Hope to meet you again one day-of course you are welcome at my place as well.
TAK & VI SES,
Charlott

Santa Claus came to my home this year! 

First time I accepted a guest in Christmas time and just before New Year Celebration. Apart from my work, we went out for catching some Turkish tastes around centre. More than all, because he brought me a running socks for Christmas we went to go running out :)  Even though he had planned just a few days in my place he kept going to stay 1 week. So I've already looking for a great Danish cook in my home, what a nice accident :) I've already looking for a repairman for my apartment but he said I had to leave for new apartment's requirements :)
Nazım Hikmet who is a famous Turkish poet asks to Abidin Dino who is a famous Turkish painter in jail, "Can you make to me the picture of beauty, kid?"

I can not, but I can describe.
It's Peter!

He is very kind man and friendly too.
We spent 1 week together​. I never forgot that.
Very friendly. Clean. Totally i think his one week was one of my best week in my life.
I am waiting for him to make another plan to travel more in Iran.
I suggest him to everyone who wants to find a new best friend.
If he wants to come back again to Iran. I can give him my homes keys again and again and again. 
Best wishes to him and her family.
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Tehran, Tehran Province, Iran, Islamic Republic Of

text: Peter, once again thank you very much for making me feel really welcome at your place and show me your favourite spots in Aarhus. I really had an amazing time with you, and i will always remember our beach moment with your sunglasses #swimming

Peter is a very kind, gentle person. We walked and biked around, cooked, shared some stories together and his positive, active attitude for life was impressive to me. 
Thanks to him, I could be much more relaxed and  calm while I was trying to figure out things for the new start in Aarhus. 
Indeed his place in Risskov is a very quiet, green,  charming area_
I appreciate for getting to know him and the moments we spent together.
Mange Tak, Peter ^^

Peter is an exceptionally great, friendly and funny Couchsurfing host. I cannot thank him enough for everything  he has done for me and for easing the start of my student life in Denmark :) He even helped me with purchasing a bike! Beside that we also hanged out a lot, we went running together, we went to a spinning class to a local fitness gym and we swam in the ocean when it had 17,8 degrees! That was such a great experience.
Peter is also a very active and positive person, he believes there's a solution to every problem :) He has also done many great things in his life (I'm sure I don't even know half of it), so he can tell you about his life story.
I would recommend Peter as a Couchsurfing host anytime! 
Thank you, Peter, for letting me stay and your place and for evreything else as well!

He is a great host, I felt like in my home, really. He is very talkative, easy going,  polite, relax, funny, generous, clean man. He is a good runner and very good cooker ( I will not forget the chicken :)) I did not stressed for  anything. I used the kitchen and cook what I want. Also he said many times: if you want to do or eat something, don't ask me, please. Just do or eat :) it was very funny. He likes tell something different about city and walk in the city, of course.  That was my first couchsurfing experience and it was perfect :) thanks a lot Peter, you are a great host

I only had a night in Aarhus, but Peter helped me make the most of it. He was welcoming and we found a lot to talk about over pizza and wine, and the next morning he even had time to show me the sites on an impromptu bike tour of the city. He's a great host and a great guy, and made my short stay in Aarhus a memorable one.
He is very kind and funny. He showed me the best parts of Aarhus. It was a pleasure meeting him. He is also a good chef :)

Awesome experience in Aarhus. 
Great perfect host! 

He showed me his, this wonderful, young and friendly city,  a small part of Aarhus countryside 
and a marvellous local place for dinner.

Thank you for this two days!
Mange tak!
I had such a blast with Peter! He took the time to show me around the city, cooked for me, and gave me career advice ;) I hope we meet again!

text: Kira you saved my soul :) I wish I could stay more time with you. Thank you very much for everything. Come to visit me to Mexico City ;)
Kira is a really nice person. I spent good time with her. Conversations in different languages were interesting, I'm really happy to have meet Kira!
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Nantes, Pays de la Loire, France

text:
Kira was so sweet to fit giving me a shelter for a night in her studying schedule. She is a very kind host! It was really nice talking to her about science and arts - she's got a really wide horizon!
Also, her dog is the cutest!
Thank you so much for sharing your cosy room, for your flexibility and for the patience with my tired brain, tending to ramble about deep stuff. ;)
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark

text: Kira is a very kind girl with a lot of interests. She's flexible and caring, she lives with the small studio but with positive energy, close to Aarhus with a sweet jumping dog ;)  Thanks for your hospitality.
Sie ist sehr nett... I like her very much...
So flexible and thoughtful!! Thanks!!

I have to thank Kira for welcoming me in her cosy studio for two nights. Risskov is right after town, but close to. A pretty green and calm area, walking distance from the sea, a wonderful bike ride from Aarhus.

Kira is determined and smart. We cooked once per each and share much opinions on many subjects. But the best moments were the walks into the parks with her cutie Ebony. So sweet!

Best of luck for your future PhD application. Sure you'll succeed, make sign whether in needs.

Ps: Beware - you might be waken up from wild beasts attacks! 🐕😜😻

Kira is an amazingly interesting girl, she does a lot of different things (music, sports, scouting, languages...), intelligent, easy-going and fun. I have spent a relaxed evening with her and her sweet little dog. I am grateful that she shared her little home with me even on a rather short notice. The location of the flat is nice and quiet, the forest is just a couple of minutes walk. 
With love,
Anna :)

Kira is really nice and helpful, she hosted me despite very last minute request. We had really nice conversations during my visit - e.g. about scouting and trees - she knows a lot about trees ;) Totally recommend. BTW Especially if you like dogs :D
Kira is really cute and so is her dog! A very tired cyclist (me) was very greatful for the cosy flat to crash in. We watched a movie and had breaky together in the morning! Would recommend!
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Capel-le-Ferne, England, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

text: Kira is a smart, funny and lovely Girl! Her dog is also really cute. We cooked and watched a film together and had a nice walk with her dog. Kira is friendly and helpful! Thank you for hosting me :)

What to say about Kira? From the very first moment, she received me with a huge Smile and as soon as I entered to her cosy place, I felt like home. She and her adorable dog have a beautiful energy! We shared movies, tea, smiles, food; we also had the opportunity to sing together, and I heard her playing the piano... A.MA.ZING!

If you wanna talk and share with an intelligent and open-minded person, definitely Kira has to be your host.

Thank you very much for everything, I'm so so happy to meet you in my life! Smile always (make it every-day task, please!)
Kira is a fantastic host :)
First and foremost, her hospitality. She is really helpful and nice to talk to. Pure kindness from Schleswig-Holstein. And her dog's so cute too!! =)

I slept two nights in Kira's cozy apartment:) she is a very very smart girl and has enough interests for 10 people ;) Therefore it was interesting to talk with her. I felt in love with her cute dog;) Thank you for your hospitality and good luck with all of your plans ;)

Kira is very kind and very flexible. She gave me a perfect shelter in Aarhus and it was a pleasure getting to know her. For travelers who expect a five start privat room it won't be an option since Kira hosts people in her own room 25 minute away from center, but for solo travelers it's all you need. Wishing you all the best in your studies and photography projects!
it was my first time trying couchsurfing and I'm so glad Kira was my first host! she was very trusting und kind. and I obviously fell in love with her dog :)

Kira was a great couchsurfing host. I stayed with her for one night but I feel like we did a lot of things. We shared music, movies, and we good conversations. She was a really thoughtful host. She cooked "pumpkin and chicken in a pot" + pasta for me and it was quite delicious. I also appreciate that she took me rock climbing. It was great!

Her little dog is so cute I wanted to take her with me on my travels. Next time Kira, thanks for everything!

Kira is definitely one of the more interesting people I have met in some time. I thought she had a good taste in music and film, and she was just a pleasure to talk to. And her dog is at least as nice as advertised. I can recommend Kira to anyone.
Kira was sweet and helpful! Would recommend.
Kira is very gently and thoughtful. We had a nice walk with her funny dog and she cooked and was open for conversations. Thank you very much for your host!

Thanks Kira.
She has received me very comfortably.
she provided me with a neat, clean and comfortable house. And she also very helpful and friendly. When I reach the city she came to pick me up(with bare feet👍).
Thanks Kira for everything! I hope you will always have a good life! And, I miss you~ Ivory~ 
Hope to see you again

Kira is a very nice Person with a cute Dog named Ebony :) She picked me up at the train station and it was a perfect start in Danmark. Kira makes a good Pasta and a delicious coffee in the Morning. Her flat is in a nice area, a big lake is next to her and good for a walk or a run. I can just recommend  to stay with Kira!!! :-)
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Königslutter am Elm, Lower Saxony, Germany

text:
My stay at Kira’s was my first experience with CouchSurfing, and it was indeed a pleasant one! Kira is a friendly and welcoming host who is easy (and interesting) to talk to, but who will also give you your space if you need it. It was also a delight to witness her unfold her many talents in drawing, singing, and much more. Her Little dog is at least as welcoming as her :). 
The apartment is located in a quiet area, perfect for evening stroll to clear you head. I can only recommend Kira as a host, if you’re mostly looking for tranquility.

I stayed at Kira's place for two nights during a bike trip through Denmark. Although most of the time I was doing tourism in Aarhus center, I must admit the time spendt at her place was way more fun than I expected.
Kira is a very interesting and interessed person. We shared a lot of music and books recommendations, talks and laughs. Her dog is funny too.
Thanks a lot and I hope we stay in touch.

I stayed at Kira's place just for one night, BUT, what an experience! Her studio was tiny but full of music, books, poetry, geek stuffs and dreams of a young woman. Despite her foot injury she picked me up at the station and prepared a wonderful dinner. Although it was her first CS experience, I can say that she was one of the best hosts I've ever had. Meet her and you won't regret!
Daniela and her friends were lovely. Would recommend them.

Daniela stayed with me for one evening and even though her English was very minimum we laughed and managed with the help of google translate. She was very respectful and polite and we actually had quite a few conversations. I had no problems hosting Daniela what so ever and can recommend her to any host. Very clean and helpful around the house. Asta la Vista Daniela and till next time. Adios
Daniela was in köln and she followed as it can be, i hope she and hers friend had a good time here :)

Daniela es una excelente persona, fue muy amable y respetuosa en todo momento, no sólo me acompaño a recorrer un poco la ciudad sino también me informó y dió buenas recomendaciones sobre la ciudad. Fue muy buena estadía ya que me sentí muy cómodo. Realmente volvería a hospedarme con ella. :)

I stayed in Al's home for two nights with my friend. His home is really really nice. He picked up us from the station, showed us the city, told us where we can eat cheapily. We didnt have much time to spend together, but he didnt mind. Evenings we spent together. Al had beers for us and did for us dessert. We spent time together laughing and talking about a lot of interesting things. Im happy that i have met such a nice person and i hope that we will meet with Al again.
I enjoyed time we spent together. Good host and person. It's a pleasure to be his guest🤩

We stayed in Al's home for two night. His home is really cosy. He picked up us from the stasion, showed us the city and the most important places in Aarhus. First evening we drank beers together and talking, and the second evening he did for us delicious dessert. He really took care of us, helped us with buses from his home to Aarhus city. He is a really nice caring person.
We can recommend him :)

It was my 1st experience to try myself a guest . i was looking for hosts In billund And Al invited to stay In his apartment which is next to skandenborg (hasselager). He picked me from bus stop, showed aarhus at evening. Prepared nice avokado salad, served fruts, chocolade suggest tea, beer. Also made shisha at evening.  He knows and shares many usefull tips about Denmark , gives suggestions , finding out answers for questions and worries about. If you need good guide, nice person to talk with-  staying  with Al should be a good decision ;) Thanks again Al, you helped me a lot ;))

It was a pleasure to host Peter. I had very little time to spend with him due to work and a captains course I was on but he waited up for me to get home to hangout. Peter was friendly and helpful and kept things clean and tidy. He also made a big and delicious vegetable soup for dinner one night when I got home from the course that I really enjoyed.  I hope to meet up with him again one day.

Ederra Peter ezagutu izana. Haren egonaldia laburra izan bazen ere, ez dut inoiz ahaztuko! Peter euskalduna da, gutako bat!! Eta han non Euskal Herriari buruz gauza berriak ikasi nituen berarekin! Marka da!😁

It's been great meeting Peter. Short but unforgettable. He speaks basque! so he's also a member of the tribe!😁 I even learnt new things about the Basque Country with him! A very nice guy!

Peter was a very courteous and polite guest. He was even thoughtful to bring me some presents from Denmark (which I totally loved), and shared many stories of his life and couchsurfing experiences in general. He was also extremely knowledgeable in his field of expertise (linguistics) and shared many insights that were new to me. Even though he was busy attending a conference on most of the days during his stay, we did get some time to hang out around some local places in Austin, and his visit will remain a memorable one. Hope our paths may cross again, Peter. Cheers and best wishes!

Merci Peter !!!!
Nous ne nous sommes pas rencontré , mais tu as mis à notre disposition ton appartement pour trois jours,quelle confiance ! Nous avons pu visiter Aarhus DK facilement car ton appartement est très bien situé. Merci beaucoup! Mani tak Peter!

I would definitely stay again at Peter's.
He is generous and experienced, an active fellow that likes to get engaged into the social and cultural events.

Being a Dutch expat, he can offer you an objective opinion on Denmark and Danes lifestyle from external point of view.

Home is a cosy studio smack in the middle of the city. You'll hardly find something more central.

Besides of hosting me, he fed me for my whole stay, invited me to an avant-garde cinema and even lent me his bike for an undetermined timing (I'll stay in Aarhus for few months)!

What else? ;)
Thanks, man!
Buen anfitrión con tema de conversación y atento, con él puedes pasar unos días agradables y como si estuvieras en tu casa.

Peter accepted a last minute couch request. He was immediately friendly and I went to an amazing concert with him on my first night. Peter is a very knowledgeable person with a lot of stories to share. He was very generous and I felt at home very quickly. We had a lovely movie night the second night with some of his friends too. What's more, the location of his flat is phenomenal and is walking distance from lots of great places which he told me loads about. I'd definitely recommend staying with him, whoever you are!

It was probably the best experience to explore Denmark's culture along with Peter. He is extremely intelligent and smart guy. We had played board games, cooked together, had New Year party with his friends who are amaizing too.
Peter is my first host, so I have nothing to compare yet, but I enjoyed Couchsurfing with him. Great location in the center of Aarhus, knowledgeable and helpful man, thanks a lot for everything!

It was my first time to use Coachsurfing and Peter brought a lot good memories to me. It was really a great experience for my weekend in Aarhus- the cozy and peaceful city is definitely a good place to spend after one week´s work!
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark

text: Peter was such a great a great host. Welcoming, friendly, helpful. He is very interesting and open-minded person - it was really great to talk with you, I enjoyed all the conversations very much :) . Thank you for the dinner and good talks!

Peter is a very nice host! Me and a friend spent one night  in Aahrus and to stay at his place was a great choice. He is helpful, friendly and makes you feel at home. He even prepared a very good meal, which was accompanied by  interesting discussions. I would definitely recommend him!

Peter is a wonderful person, he knows so many interesting things in such a broad range of topics, he shares his knowledge with an open heart. His home is very cosy and we felt very comfortable. it is great to see that Peter is such an active
 CS host always ready to help others. we thank you very much Peter for hosting us. hope to see you again. you will have a home in Australia

Thanks to Peter,  I had a really enjoyable first couchsurfing experience. He was very nice and relaxed and offered me help regarding were to go and what to do in Aarhus. We also cooked dinner together and had a lot of fun conversations about bad jokes in various languages.  I would absolutely stay again!
Best regards from Berlin :-)

It was our first time using couchsurfing, so we might have been a bit shy...Peter welcomed us in his artist flat, and as we did not want to disturb him as much as possible, we invited Peter to eat in a very nice restaurant to thank him (the min. we could do, as we could not bring any bottle of Cider from France.. :-( )...Then, he showed us around the town on our way back home...
We enjoyed very much Aarhus and we could do everything by foot, as Peter is located in the best area of the town center!
P.S: Peter was very happy to speak French with us, eventhough we speak E!
Thanks, and remember to pop in the SW of France one day!
Nicolas & Karina

Peter is a very welcoming and open person, and fascinating to listen to when it is about languages and cultures. His knowledge of french culture also pleased me a lot. Definitely Peter has a great sense of hospitality and generosity, i had a great stay at his place :)
Peter! Thank you again for your hospitality and letting me stay with you for the night :) I really appreciate it!

I had a good and calm stay with Peter, he helped me with a small map to discover the city, I had a good sleep in his couch, just what I needed, in the morning we had breakfast togheter. Then I went on my way.
Peter is a very kind and nice person.  He lives in a perfect position in the centre and he's a great cooker

This was my first time couchsurfing, and  it was a great first experience. I would definitely recommend staying with Peter, especially if you're interested in music or languages, or if you want to experience the culture of Aarhus.  He was very hospitable and happy to share his extensive knowledge of the city.  He made me dinner, which was much appreciated after a few days of travelling, and he showed me some highlights of the area around his place, which is in a great location near the city centre. He also helped me figure out where I could get the things I need for staying in Aarhus for a few months, and told me about events that happen in the city.

It was my first time couchsurfing, and I'm so glad that I got to stay with Peter! He was very kind, welcoming, and easy to talk to! I told him I was studying urban planning, and he showed me around to places in the city that he knew I would find cool and interesting! He's a really great host and an even better person!
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark

text: Peter was very friendly and hospitable and was an excellent host. It was a pleasure meeting and spending time with him. He was also very thoughtful and went "above and beyond" when he helped me find the bus station.

My stay at Peters place was great! Peter is a very friendly host, who tells a lot of interesting and funny story's. But not only the stories are good, the food he made was delicious too!! I would definitly stay there again!

We spent a great time with Peter in Aarhus. We gave us tips and precious information about the city. He is an interesting man with great stories. We went together to a comedy and it was nice. Lovey house in a super central position. Thanks a lot for having us and I hope to see you soon somewhere out there :)
Very friendly and nice....

I'm really sorry that we spent such a short time together, and that I didn´t have the opportunity to know you better and to visit the city properly... I hope that one day I´ll come back to Aarhus or you can come to my place, you´ll allways be very welcome! Thanks for hosting me,  for the lovely dinner, for the interesting conversations and for showing me around, it has been a pleasure to meet you and to spend time with you. I wish you the best, and I left you some international chocolates, but don´t eat too many of them :)
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Brighton, England, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

text: Peter is an amazing person who showed me a lot of good music and with him I had really good time of conversations and exchange of cultures and language.

Super nice place, with a good atmosphere and location. Peter is very nice, and an incredibly interesting person. Truly enjoyed staying there over the weekend. Peter accepted my friend and I, who came to Århus to do a show, on the day, and seemed fine with our turbulent and haphazard communication and schedules.

Peter's reply on my request came very fast ... this makes planning  during a long journey, easier. 
To explore the city, Peter's location is splendid. 
He was clear in  making appointments, and gave me 'the freedom to roam',
as I am used when I'm in my tent: writing a bit, looking at the map for a while, sorting out luggage,  implement minor repairs. 
So ... I felt Welcome !
Kind and welcoming host. Good experience.

Peter was very kind to us and we had an nice new invented meal :)
His home is in a really cool area would love to come back and check it out there!
Maybe see you again in Aarhus :D

I experienced Peter as a very welcoming, warm-hearted man who generously opened his home to me and openly shared both time and an interesting part of his amazing life-experience. I can warmly recommend Peter as a host and guest. Thank you for everything, Peter!

Peter was a really nice guy. He generously opened his home to my husband and I and wanted to spend time with us. It was great to hear a few of his stories and listen to some of the music he's collected over the course of his travels. You're a wonderful man Peter and we were really grateful to spend a couple days with you! Thank you for everything!
Peter is  a very welcoming and warm-hearted guy. Also he is a interesting Person, who is able to make memorable and enjoyable conversation.
I had a brief but enjoyable stay with Peter. Wish I could have stayed longer. Thanks for everything Peter! Look forward to hosting you in India some day.

Peter is an amazing host. He will cook you the best meals, show you around if he has the time, besides living in a perfect location. Also, his couch is super comfortable so you'll have awesome rest. I would recomend him either as host or guest. Many thanks my friend!
Despite he already had surfers, Peter accepted to host us in his home during Northside  Festival for four nights. He was friendly, flexible and always ready to help. We are really thankful of him!

Peter is an excellent host and a very kind and warmhearted person. He is laidback, flexible and takes good care of his guests. We loved to stay at his place and he made our trip to Aarhus even more memorable. We strongly recommend him as a host.

Peter is an amazing person! He is peaceful and always in a good mood. Is really interesting to talk with him, because he is well informed and knows about different cultures, films, food, festivals... also he helped us repairing our bike and tought how to do it. We had such a wonderful stay at his place. I hope we can meet each other again to have a good time! :)

Peter is a flexible, friendly and knowledgable host. Peter replied to my message quickly when I was looking for hosts in Aarhus. He not only offered to stay and helped me to change dates due to my travel plans delayed. Peter's house is in a very central location. I am grateful that he shares food, time, thoughts, board game and boat riding on the river in the center during my stay! I'd recommend Peter for surfers who are looking for hosts in Aarhus!
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Sanxia District, New Taipei City, Taiwan, Republic Of China

text: Peter is really nice. I stayed one night in his apartment and I think he is really thoughtful. Peter is a gentleman and he loves his daughters so much. When I arrived Aarhus, Peter showed me around the city and tell me the history of the city. I think Peter is a good host. Also knowledgable and fun !
Peter is the most flexible person I have ever got in touch with. He accepted my request one day before arrivel.
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark

text: Peter is a very friendly and helpful host. I spent 3 nights at his place and on my first evening he already offered me a delicious dinner. Thanks to Peter I could saw also Copenhagen during my stay and I could get to know other friendly and open-minded people too! I definitely recommend staying at his place and I'd be glad to host Peter one day in my hometown, Budapest! :)

Peter is a nice, friendly, easy-going and caring host! It's easy to get to his house. He took me to cycle to the seaside and we played board games together after dinner. It was really a nice time to stay with Peter.  He is knowledgeable. He knows many things and we got a very nice chat. It's so interesting to tell him something about the languages we use in Hong Kong. I like the 'decoration' in his house - the 'gifts' for him from the surfers, and he showed me some of them. And the couch is very comfortable and you would have your own privacy during night ;D  If I have a chance to go Aarhus again, I would definitely find Peter again.  'Dor Jie, Peter'  Thanks so much!
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Hong Kong, New Territories, Hong Kong

text:
Peter was a great host for our first Couch-Surfing experience!
He was very flexible in time and even welcomed us with a nice supper!
We spent two very nice evenings with intersting conversations at his place!
He also provided us with lots of Info about the area leading to two really beautiful days in Aarhus.
Therefore would definetly recommend Peter as a host!!!

I think Peter was my best host here in Denmark so far !!! ❤️ He just confirmed again my amazing experiences with people from Netherlands, even though living in different places:) he made my stay in Aarhus much more rich and meaningful, i had such a great time with him!!:) 
You are more than welcome to come to Prague or i hope i will see you soon anyway!!:)
A tres bientot!:) ciaao V

Peter is quite flexible, he approved my request even though I contacted him just one day before my arrival. He is very helpful and willing to share his living-room, kitchen etc just as if I were at home. We had an enjoyable discussion when I arrived for about 2 hours, I'm very happy that I got the chance to meet him. He provided me a perfect first-surfing experience!

At the first day I arrived in Denmark, I hosted by peter for 3 nights. After having eaten dinner we went to upper floor of a restaurant named Gyngen where there were some rock music performances. That was really awesome. Peter is very friendly, thoughtful and helpful and I really felt at home. We talked about different languages and cultures and enjoyed our time.

i surfed with a friend at his couch for 2 nights, at the first evening we had a dinner with him and his family, afterwards we were going to a small but good cinema where we had see a good movie, at the second evening he organised a nice meetup in his place where a lot of nice people came, he is a friendy and active man.

Peter was really friendly, kind and helpful. It was great to spend time with him, chat, share stories and our thoughts about life and the world. Although I only stayed in Aarhus one night, Peter provided me lots of fun by introducing me to his lively neighbourhood. The night saw us take in Vietnamese food, bohemian cafes, live 'Americana' music and an 80s Italian horror B-movie in the unforgettable setting of a  40 seater secret, underground cult cinema! So all in all .... a highly enjoyable and memorable couchsurfing experience.  Thank you so much Peter!

Peter hosted me and my entire band Svarta Stugan when we passed Århus as the first stop of a small tour. We were 5 people in total, but he still offered us to stay at his place which turned out perfectly! Also Peter himself turned out be a really nice and openminded guy with a lot of stories and a big music lover. He was during all of our stay very helpful and friendly and we had a really good time together.

text: I have had the most wonderful time at Peter's place. I arrived at his house without him being there, and I met his daughter, Iris. We immediately got along so well. Peter has introduced me to one of my fav new musical mysteries: Jaap Fischer. It has been one of the, not the best couchsurfing experience I've ever had. Apart from the nice conversations, the support, the lovely dinners and all the fun we had, this man is a just good one. (:
response: {'id': '14939120', 'text': 'It was a pleasure to have Xandra as a guest. She is a friendly, reliable, curious person, who listens not only to other, but also more and more to herself. She sings and plays guitar in a very sensitive way. If you do some effort, you can find her on Youtube playing and singing in Aarhus.', 'createdDate': '2014-03-19T15:42:28Z', 'experience': 'positive', 'relationshipType': 'host', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '4466522'}, 'from': {'id': '1619821', 'publicName': 'Peter Bakker', 'publicAddress': {'id': '4324943', 'description': 'Aarhus, Aarhus Municipality, Denmark'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/images.couchsurfing.us/AUPK3R0/19262345_l_8f2a9602936c632a2434064470a5ca91.jpg', 'status': 'maybe', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

text: Peter is a very nice guy, outgoing and although he has quite a hefty professional life, eager to show you around some of the city's semi-underground venues you wouldn't come across on your own.

text: Peter, thanks a lot for hosting us, it was really very pleasant to stay in your nice and cosy place! Peter gave us his bycicles and we discovered Aarhus by cycling around. He is very educated person, cheerful, ready to help. We enjoyed being in Aarhus with this kind guy!
response: {'id': '13989239', 'text': 'Julia and her friend Pavel spent three days at my place. They were going out to watch volleyball matches. They are friendly, reliable, quiet and independent. text: Peter was an absolutely wonderful host. He was very knowledgeable (he can speak quite a few languages!), welcoming and was very caring. He took us for a walking trip around Aarhus during the Aarhus-fest that turned out to be really fun. His living room was very tastefully decorated (his daughter's work I believe) and was very cool. He accommodated me in-spite of his busy schedule and opened up his home to me in such a welcoming way that it was an absolute delight staying with him. Thanks Peter for everything!

text: I stayed with Peter one full day and had a perfect time. Peter, as has already been said, is easy going and the quintessential host for someone like me who doesn't need too much attention. My stay was the ideal mix of time spent mooching around Aarhus, making my own discoveries, and time spent socialising with Peter and his friends. What I appreciated was that Peter, whilst available to answer questions, doesn't over load you with information or overdirect you, so the independant minded traveller can experience Aarhus in their own way. Aarhus is a very nice town to visit. All the best to you Peter, thanks again.
response: {'id': '13228828', 'text': 'Karen is an ideal couchsurfer. She is very nice, reliable, considerate and fun, with lots of life experience and stories to tell. She can go her own way and explore, planned or spontaneously, and she is also good company when you want to do things together. You are welcome back anytime, Karen! I hope to see you soon!', 'createdDate': '2013-06-11T13:53:38Z', 'experience': 'positive', 'relationshipType': 'host', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '2776085'}, 'from': {'id': '1619821', 'publicName': 'Peter Bakker', 'publicAddress': {'id': '4324943', 'description': 'Aarhus, Aarhus Municipality, Denmark'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/images.couchsurfing.us/AUPK3R0/19262345_l_8f2a9602936c632a2434064470a5ca91.jpg', 'status': 'maybe', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

text: He is the best host I have ever seen. Whenever and wherever I need his help, he was there. I spared last week of my life in Arhus to spend on his couch. He is very trustworthy and generous in all meanings. We cooked for each other and for some other CSers, we spend very very nice moments and experiences. He has lots of things to tell about life and its beauties, if you are ready to listen. He is second best cook right after my mother, I have seen. His home in Arhus is very cosy and in centre of the city, if you want to hang out for a beer or to socialize your experience in that city, here is best I guess. I would like to share that moments with my future hosts and surfers, same as I wish for Peter.

We found Peter and his family very caring and interesting, outgoing people with good sense of humour. This was the very first time when we surfed and our expectations were completely fulfilled :) We were very glad to have handy tourist information gathered by Peter, this helped us to navigate Aarhus with more confidence, so we were relaxed and happy. 
 Hope to see Peter and his relatives in our hometown some day!

You cant miss meeting Peter. He is a wonderful person and great host, who gave unforgetable hospitality to me during my stay in Aarhus.Peter is kind, jolly and full of life man and has great interst in endangered languages and cultures , music and cooking. We had non-stop conversations about saving languages and he showed me many places in aarhus.I higly recommend him to all couch surfers.
Very Best , thank you Peter! See You soon....
This guy is a legend!
column18: {'text': 'Right back at you sir!', 'author': {'id': '2002560245', 'publicName': 'Nick Fitzpatrick', 'publicAddress': {'id': '117298087', 'description': 'Aarhus C, Denmark'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/ht-images.couchsurfing.com/u/2002560245/7195DDEE-AE1D-48A2-8ED3-37F1ED3231F3', 'status': 'yes', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'createdDate': '2018-10-11T17:38:29Z'}

text: I'm grateful that I met Nick, I loved our conversations, he is interesting and generous as. Plus he knows the best things to do in the Gong. Usefull aye. His housemates are all chill and nice. I had such a great time at his place. Don't hesitate!

Nick was an excellent host! He came to pick us up from the train station and suggested things we could do around Wollongong. He was friendly and we felt very welcome in his home. We had a great weekend together and he is a very interesting guy to talk to! I would recommend anyone to stay with Nick!

text:
I had a great time staying with Nick, we got along very well, even though he's a pain in the ass most of the time (just kidding). He made time for me even though he also had to take care of uni-stuff and made sure I always had something interesting to do. Thanks to him and his housemates I now know more about Bob Ross than anybody should in a lifetime, yeey :P Anyways, I loved Nick's cooking and his general lifestyle, I got the feeling we think pretty similar about lots of things. 

I'd highly recommend Nick to everybody as host & human being, I loved my time in Wollongong ;)

Definitely hope to see you in Europe some time, no matter where you end up!

He also made sure to tell us this before letting us stay. If you don’t know who Bob Ross is, you are going to find out. See you in Sweden Nick :)
