text:
Came to meet me after I got a tad confused finding his house. Nice place, allowed to eat food and drink whatever I wanted pretty much. 

Had a lot in common both being environmental people, so good to chat. Was keen to show me places, especially ones others might not consider. 

Made a good pasta pesto :)

And even though he had work made sure I had an idea of places to see, directions on how to get there and was just generally happy to share knowledge about the area, which is always nice to learn :)

text: Fredrik and his friend Dominika ended up in Leeuwarden during hithiking trip.  I really enjoyed their company and hithiking stories. They also helped me to fix my bike and replant flowers!

Super amazing man with a great heart. Helped out around the house and is nothing but joy to be around! If you get a chance to host Frederik make sure you do. Peace and love my brothers and safe journey

Frederik is young and brave..he searches his chances and borders kindly and happily..
we haven't met a lot but I am happy to have helped you relax for one night..good luck!
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Drama, East Macedonia and Thrace, Greece

text: Frederik was to cool for school. Great energy and was super helpful around the house even built me some stairs beside my house where he pick axed thru stone to complete the mission. He's a grill master chief and always cleaned up after himself. He traveled with a lovely young lady that was a ball of joy. He's a hiker, dare devil and just lover of life.
Laid back traveler, low maintenance, easy to be around. Found my place on the second try, but that's probably a Danish thing. ;D Good luck on your trip, mate!
Frederik is the greatest person you can ever have sleeping on your couch! He's an openminded fella, fun, caring, and does not need any luxury to feel good (he didn't even get a couch but maddress :))
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: On a boat, Region of Central America, Panama

text:
I stayed at Frederiks place for one night only but I had a very good time. His flat is super central and cozy, I felt right at home. I enjoyed our conversations about travelling and how weird the Danish language is. Thank you for having me and giving me some advice on what to do in Kopenhagen!

If you're ever in the frankfurt area, let me know!
He was really sweet and we had a really nice conversation!!! Lovely guy

Thank you again for the stay frederik! I had such a nice time  on my short stay. I got really what i wanted from aarhus and from the  school you showed me. You are a charasmatic and clever  person i liked sharing thoughts and travelstories with! 

Untill next time, many thanks! :) 
Karl

My stay with Anders was at easy as it could be. His formate was also very friendly. They welcomed me with a beer and some food that they made themselves with love. They were so generous I just don’t know how to thank them. Anders gave me some ideas of things I could do and visit, and the next day he showed me some other places, a bit more local. That was lovely. Unfortunately I feel like I didn’t stay long enough. We had long discussions about danish culture and food, which was also wonderful because I really felt part of it. I will definitely be back to Århus. Thank you for everything Anders.

It was a pleasure to be Anders' guest. He has a great hyggelig apartment and lovely flatmates. It was my first couchsurfing experience after a big break, so I was a little bit nervous, but the guys happened to be very helpful, caring and friendly. We shared a couple of beers and stories, and I did enjoy that. 
Almost forgot, they make fantastic coffee!

Anders took me  to an awesome little basement bar that I never would have discovered on my own. He was kind, intelligent, and made for some great conversation! He had a ton of knowledge of the city and was able to recommend plenty of things to do/places to see, left me with some brochures and such to peruse, and was happy to share some traditional Danish food with me. The space was clean and comfy and the other roommate was kind as well. Would definitely surf here again :)

My friend Kristina and I stayed at Anders' place for 3 nights during Spot Festival and I can say that it has been one of the most eventful Couchsurfing experiences I've had so far. 

From grabbing beers at 2 pm together with his other roomies (Morten and Anders "the second"), to regretfully ringing their door bell at 4 am, to tempting them to join us for one day during the festival and dance in different venues around Aarhus, to finally grabbing morning pizzas together, in order to sooth the hangovers. 

All in all it has been a great pleasure to have Anders as a host and I can definitely recommend him for your future trip to Aarhus. :)
He and his girlfriend stayed one night. They made a nice dinner for us all and they were very pleasant company. I would welcome them in my home anytime.

Villads og jeg mødtes til en kop kaffe og interessant snak om alt muligt. Villads kom forbi samme aften og surfede min sofa. Han er utrolig høflig og hjælpsom, og så kan han fortælle utrolig meget om kunstig intelligens. Jeg er ikke sikker på jeg helt forstår det endnu, men spændende er det i hvert fald. Jeg håber du har heldet med dig til at finde en programmør:)

text:
Best couch-surfing experience ever! Not even exaggerating. Villads and his girlfriend Lian are super lovely humans that you don't get to know so often in life. I feel really really lucky.
1. Happy. Hahaha, Villads said his camera and some CDs were lost in a home robbery. Then he said, he was actually happy because he wasn't using the camera and now it's useful to someone. " It probably makes the thief  a photographer and he one day comes back to thank me that I changed his life!"  
2. Reliable.  I didn't expect reliability on couch surfing. It's a natural risk included if you choose CS to travel. But he confirmed my arrival time, location and even walked to the station to pick me up. 
3. Patience. It's really exhausting to be a CS host. I constantly needed help with basically everything.
4. Generous. They were sharing everything with me. As a CS guest, I feel extremely flattered. 
5. Interesting. They both have very interesting personality. 
Wanted to write more.. In one word : thanks
column18: {'text': 'You are lovely! Thank you. Tell me about your trip and how your test went', 'author': {'id': '385139', 'publicName': 'Villads Olesen', 'publicAddress': {'id': '3090287', 'description': 'Aarhus, Aarhus Municipality, Denmark'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/ht-images.couchsurfing.com/u/385139/2710b0f0-8e36-4bd2-84c1-175713ca740d', 'status': 'yes', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'createdDate': '2016-02-09T15:38:42Z'}

text: I stayed with Villads, his girlfriend and a friend outside of town in their weekend house. We drove there together from Århus. It was a smooth drive and everybody was super friendly and nice. We had dinner together and chat a bunch. Overall we had a good time. Would recommend him to other CSs as well!

even though my stranding  in (beautiful!) aarhus came surprisingly&spontaneous, in villads i found a host i couldn't have dreamed of before.  it was a great pleasure chatting away with this very openminded, interesting and warmhearted fellow... see you, villads! and may it be better sooner than later¡!

text: Villads var utrolig sjov og meget venlig på samme tid. Det var meget underholdende at spille gta for første gang og så hyggede vi også til noget film den anden aften. Ville højt anbefale Villads, han har virkelig karisma, godt humor, og så laver han mad og er musestille hvis man sover når han skal på arbejde. ^^ Ville være sjovt at tage ud på landet sammen, måske en anden gang :)
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark

text: Denmark, June 2011, so many good memories! I think Villads is one of the most open-minded, inspiring people I have ever met. And he's an amazing host - he hosted me and my friend in the middle of a field in... tipi (really!). He picked us up from the airport, he spent so much time with us, introduced us to his friend Peter, we made elderflower pancakes, he showed us around. I've had such a great time, and thinking about these three days always makes me smile. We stayed in touch ever since and I hope that we will see each other again.

Villads has a small apartment but it's incredible how easily you can find room for everything in there:) He's an hospitable guy and he can entertain you very well with his studies on phonetics. He's also not far from the Train Station and the Town centre.
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: San Giovanni Al Natisone, Friuli-Venezia Giulia, Italy

text:
Martin and his wife were excellent hosts! Our flight was delayed for six hours and we arrived to their flat really late but it wasn't problem for them. In the morning we ate danish breakfast together and were talking a lot about our countries and Aarhus. Irena baked also Dream cake - traditional danish one, give us some souvenirs and recommend some great places in Aarhus which we didn't know. It was amazing time even if it was so short :) 
Irena, Martin, you're amazing! Thanks a lot for everything! :)

Martin and Irena are kind, friendly and talkative couple. They met through Couchsurfing :)
I enjoyed my time with them in their welcoming home. They shared dinner with me and I had a good rest on their comfortable couch, which was much needed after all day of visiting Aarhus. 
Thank you for your hospitality guys and I hope to see you again.
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Kingston upon Thames, England, United Kingdom

text: Irena and Martin are a generous, gregarious and attentive duo.  Their welcoming and openness made my first CS stay a memorable experience.  Both Irena and Martin are well-traveled: they are aware and curious about socio-cultural happenings in the world.  Thank you!

Martin is friendly, hospitable, very intelligent, and full of tips about Aarhus. He has a superbly located appartment. He took me in and around Aarhus university where he used to work and teach (it's an amazingly open and nice place to be), he introduced me to the great concept of the Folkeuniversitet, gave me some tips to help learn Danish, and indulged me in a nice game of chess.  My stay with Martin was my very first couchsurfing experience, and it was a good one!

text: Surfing with Martin was an amazing experience! He was very polite, welcoming and knowledgeable and made me feel at home from the moment we met. He has this amazing place right in the center of Aarhus and he took me for a fun walking tour of Aarhus and showed me all the important sights and places. He also invited me to see a Danish short film thing and that was very very interesting. We had really interesting conversations about a variety of topics and he came across as an extremely well informed and intelligent person. It was a pleasure discussing all those topics with him and learning more about Denmark. It is a pity we never got to play a little chess. I imagine that would have been really fun. Thank you for the wonderful experience Martin! Do visit India sometime!

text:
We were more than happy to stay at Martin’s place. There were three of us so it was very hard to find a couch as we wanted to stay together but Martin was very helpful and understanding; we were planning to stay at his apartment for only a couple of nights but as long as we couldn’t find any other place he let us stay for more time. Martin is awesome, me and my friends really enjoyed spending time with him, we cooked together, had breakfast in the mornings, he taught us how to play a Danish card game and gave us useful tips how to survive in Denmark if you are new here. It was always interesting to talk to him, because he is so open minded and has a great sense of humor. Thanks a lot, Martin!
We are looking forward to seeing you in our new apartment!
Laura, Agne and Roberta

text:
This was my first time in Couchsurfing and it was great!
Matt was a good host and he offers to show us beautiful places in Aarhus after we arrived. He also offers to take our luggage to his house so we can continue in the city center and give us some good advices about places to go. 
We (me and my friend) also jointed him and his friends for some games and drinks and it was really fun! 
The room was also really comfortable ans we have had a great time in that beautiful city!
Tak Matt,
All the best :)

Matt woke up super early just to show me and my friend the best “hygge” place in Aarhus. He was super flexible, gave us good tips to visit the city, and showed us really nice places. 
His place is clean and the dorm is super cosy, everyone is so friendly. We had a short but really good time with him! See you next time

My stay with Matt was my first experience with couchsurfing and it was great. Matt was really nice, happy to show me around Aarhus and introduced me to his friends. text:
SO.. u are looking for someone u can trust, some one who can give u the time of youre life, someone so positive that i envy him.. matt is THE guy!
such an awsome dude who listens and respect everyone...
i'll see u soon man

Michael has been such a cool guest. He really embodies the couch surfing spirt. He stayed with me for about a week, longer than I have ever hosted before. When he leaves, it will feel like loosing a roommate! He was at my place along with 3 other surfers, and he was kind and social with them, we all became close friends quickly. He could befriend someone half his age, or a total stranger with ease. Great conversationalist and had awesome ideas. Can't wait to visit him in Denmark one day!

Dmitriy was an awesome host! He met us on a train station, showed us a city, all the best places of Aarhus. He is also very friendly, talkative and knowledgeable (especially a beer guru 😁). We hanged out together, he told us so much about beer, even though I was not a big beer fun but after this trip I would definitely change my mind.
Dima amazed us with card tricks like a true magician. 
His apartment was new, clean and comfortable. Everything went great!:)
Dima thank you very much for having us! See you in Lviv 🙂

Dmitry and his neighbor Andres are extremely nice guys. My brother and I stayed in their cute apartment in Aarhus for one night. They were very helpful, welcoming, friendly and offered us everything we might need. They are also very smart and intelligent, they told us a lot about their lives and taught us some interesting games, so we went to bed very late, even though we had a flight back next day 😅 We were lucky to stay at their place, as we liked them a lot! Thank you very much guys!

Kirstine is a great guest. She is super fun, has so much to talk about, is really positive, and has a great vibe of positive energy. We only had one night together, but it was full of good food, friends, and laughs. I'm so glad she stayed with me, and of course she is welcome back any time!

She and her friend Sabina stayed with me together for 4 nights , They both are so smart & well educated , intelligent , kind, generous , understanding, experienced .. We had great time together , We tried '' Kumpir '' as first time in my flat which was extremly delicious :) U should definitely host both ' em if you are looking for some fun & doing activities together .. Thanks a lot for everything guys , I ll miss you moth .. have a good journey to Georgia 
bye for now 
Ciao 
take care

Kirstine was a lovely host and a great first stay for me on Couchsurfing! She was very knowledgeable about both local attractions (and offered free entry!) and places further afield in Denmark when helping me with changes to my trek route. 

Kirstine was also very flexible with the change to plans and allowed me to come and go as I pleased. Each morning Kirstine would provide a delicious and nutritional breakfast that we sat and shared 😊

I would definitely stay with Kirstine again and if I'm ever back in Aarhus would love to meet up for a coffee or some drinks!
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Evesham, England, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

text: Kirstine was a sweet host. Even though I only spent a night at her place she was understanding and acomodating. A lady with a good vibe and some cool roommates who were also sweet always checking I was comfortable. Thanks for hosting me...:)

Kirstine accepted to host me and Roberta pretty soon.
It helped us to stay close to the city (easy to get by the frequent busses passing there).
She also gave us some advices about places to visit in Aarhus, and tips to get a better experience in ARoS museum.
The sofa was very confortable. 
– Thank you Kirstine again for your hospitality.

I stayed with Kristine one night. She was very flexible in my arrival and departure times. She could not welcome me when I arrived. I was welcomed by her roommate Kim. I spent most of my time with Kim as Kristine was volunteering. Kim was very friendly, and fun to hang out with. He showed me the city, we went to a climate change festival and I shared a dinner with his mum and sister.
I got to spend some time with Kristine in the evening and the morning of my departure. She is very friendly, laid-back and flexible. I will recommend staying with her.

It was really very nice to stay with kirstine! She was welcoming and flexible and one could feel that she loved to host people and connect with them. She answered us all our questions and it was interesting to have a chat with her and an awesome place to sleep . Thank you!
Very kindly hosted us last minute . Very friendly, sofa bed was very comfy and such a great breakfast she served to us in the morning ! Thanks again Kristine

Kristine was absolutely great! I was on a spontanious roadtrip with a friend and she hosted us last-minute even though she was quite busy (...doing a dance performance in town which we accidentally walked into :) Thanks for the breakfast and the bed. It was quite unfortunate that we had to leave before we came back, we hadn't checked the distances yet and thought it wasnt as far. I think we will see again though, here in Flensburg or perhaps Aarhus and then (hopefully) with more time.

-Timo

Kirstine is great!! The best host ever! She organized everything to make me feel at home, she made the best breakfast ever and you can speak hours with her about different topic and she always has a very interesting point of view. Her home is awesome, with a very nice location and clean. She lives with two roommate, I only met Nicklas and he was so friendly!
Best place and best people of Aarhus!
Thanks Kirstine for everything!
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Buenos Aires, Buenos Aires City, Argentina

text: Kirstine is very friendly and caring. She made me dinner when I arrived and helped me find the best things to do in Aarhus. I had a great time!

Kirstine is a wonderful person and I am very happy to get to know her. She is very kind and opened and also she cooks really well. 

The place was clean and nice, easy to find. Kirstine provided me with towel and all the sleeping stuff. She did everything to make my stay comfortable. 

I kindly recommend Kirstine as a good host and very nice person.

Kristine has what I call the true CS spirit. We had very nice and interesting conversations, cooked for each other and played card games. Although she was very busy and had not very much time, she was so kind to offer us a stay at her place. We felt very welcome and appreciated the time a lot. Hope to see you again.

It was a pleasure to stay with Kristine and her friends , she accepted my request in days when she was busy and described the location very easy to find . text: Kristine is a great person. She is very welcoming and made me feel at home very quickly. Totally recommended! Thank you for offering me to sleep in dry place for one night! :)

What a wonderful stay i had with Kirstine! She cared so much to make me feel confortable, to make me feel like home and at the same time she did it so naturally!! It has been very interesting to talk with, to watch movies and cook strange things. These three days i spent with her were very pleasent, i never felt we were strangers at all. Kirstine cheerful and active girl. I could not say until the last moment, when I arrive, but she was absolutely calm and flexible about it. She is one of the most active host in Armenia. And the best in Gyumri. I spent a few wonderful days in the company of Kirstine and her neighbors . The first night came four travelers and we had a travel-party. Kirstine was busy during the day, but we were together for breakfast and dinner, during which we could communicate.
Thank you a lot Kirstine and welcome to Petersburg!

Kirstine invited me over kind of last-minute -- same day I met her -- but I had a fabulous time. She provided me with a mattress, linen and thick blanket to sleep in, all of which I really appreciated. I, she, and the three others who were staying over chatted about all sorts of topics at night and during the next morning, when she helped prepare breakfast for all of us. For my first Couchsurfing experience, it was charming. Thanks much, Kirstine, and hope to see you again in the future (perhaps in America)!
Kristine and her flatemates are really sweet ! I had a good evening with them ! Thanks again :D
Christine was friendly and interesting people, delicious cooking. Thank you)

Kirstine and Sabina and Sebastian hosted me and my travel mate for 2 nights.
Giumri was so cold and we felt warm when we arrived to their place at midnight.
they are 3 persons from 3 different cultures are living together for 6 months.
Kirstine is experienced .she accepted us kindly and her home mate Sebastian showed us around city and we took a walk with him friendly.
hope to see you 3 in Iran.
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Shiraz, Fars, Iran, Islamic Republic Of

text: We stayed for a couple of days with Kirstine (and home mates) and we felt so welcomed, like one more member of the house! They shared their local knowledge and make our visit to Gyumri much more enjoyable, thank you very much!! :)

Kirstie was so nice that she picked us up from the street while it was very late at night. She explained us the best places of the city and cooked us a delicious Danish pasta with cheese. I enjoyed helping her to cook bread. Eben if she was ill in the time we were in jer place, she was always in a good mood and smiling. She kindly woke up very early in the morning to say us goodbye. 
She was very kind, hospitable and lovely. I hope to meet her in Iran soon.

Kristine is so nice and kind girl.we stayed in her house for 3 nights with another her flatmates.We cooked in her house,had a little conversation while eating maybe this time was'nt too much but it's enough for me to know this cute girl due to accepted us with warm_heart.
I hope to see you again Kirstine
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Tehran, Tehran, Iran, Islamic Republic Of

text:
Kristine is full of conversations  and sympathy. 
I stayed in her house for two nights with two more friends in February and she showed a great support from the beginning. We cooked in her house and shared a bit of their life. We had great conversations while eating, and I really enjoyed talking to her and to know what she does in Gyumri. 
Four more months, you can do it!  I wish you all the best and hope to see you again in Dilijan.
:D
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: London, England, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

text: Kirstine and her flatmates were really fun to stay with. After a few days of hitchhiking through Turkey and Armenia where nobody spoke English, it was great to meet some people who we could have a full conversation with. They were very welcoming, made us a great dinner and breakfast, and great people to talk to. Hope you guys come to Gudauri so I can teach you to ski! :)

It was evening when I ended up in Gyumri without a place to sleep. I wrote Kirstine and she instantly accepted my request and when she picked me up just minutes later I was immediately invited to join her and her friends for some drinks. Altogether a great night with lots of fun.

Kirstine is a very relaxed and easygoing person so if you have a chance definitely host, meet or stay with her.

Kristine is a very warm and welcoming person. Together with Sebastian and Sabine she host us for a night. We made a nice meal together and chatted the night away. I felt like I was visiting old friends. I can recommend to couchsurf or host Kristine if you get the chance!

I met Kirstine when traveling on winter Armenia. She took care of me in Gumri, where the night temperature -9. She and her roommate Sabina were so nice and interesting girls. They have a large and bright apartment right in the center of Gumri. Thank you for everything, I hope we'll see in spring

Really great couchsurfing experience! I had planned to stay in Gyumri for 1 night but eventually stayed 3 nights. Kirstine is really friendly, kind and welcoming host. Her flat is very cosy. Thanks to her I learnt a lot about volunteering in Armenia and how is it to live in such place for Europeans with no knowledge of the language or culture :)

Kirstine saved me on a cold night in Gyumri with a last minute couch request. Even though I turned up at 1am she even went so far as to stand on the side of the road and wait for me. She and Sabrina were the perfect hosts. Super chilled, up for random walks and generally smiley, happy company. 'Twas a pleasure. Thank you :-)

I thoroughly enjoyed hosting Mie! She's a lovely young woman, adventurous, funny, quiet, yet good conversationalist. Mie made good use of her time here, borrowing my housemate's bike and taking in a lot of the city on two wheels. I had to work while she was here, but she treated me to dinner one evening, and she let me treat her to my favorite ice cream in the Cities, and I was able to show her around a bit. 

It was great hearing about her five months in Honduras, and also learning a bit about life in Denmark. 

Mie, you are welcome at the cottage any time!
Really good time. Don't hesitate, those guys are cool. Hope we can have a last drink before you leave Lebanon! See you
Had great time hanging with Jonas and Nik. Helped me buy some tax free alcohol :)
I hosted Jonas and his friend for one tonight in Avignon as they were doing a hitchhiking trip in the region. They were really nice and, we had a great time. Would happily host them again =)
response: {'id': '17879358', 'text': 'My friend and I stayed with Mathilde for two days. She is a very kind and easy going person, and she showed us around in Avignon, so I will definetly recommend to stay with her!', 'createdDate': '2015-07-22T14:02:04Z', 'experience': 'positive', 'relationshipType': 'surf', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '4159735'}, 'from': {'id': '1001050785', 'publicName': 'Jonas Mortensen', 'publicAddress': {'id': '9003343', 'description': 'Aarhus, Aarhus Municipality, Denmark'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/ht-images.couchsurfing.com/u/1001050785/cdcbf390-7e7d-4c66-9c30-0bb86c7e2cf4', 'status': 'maybe', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

text: Luc and Anne were lovely hosts! Right from the beginning Luc was very easy going. He made dinner for us upon our arrival. Luc had made a wonderful dinner for us! We had a very pleasant time in good company. Later in the evening Anne arrived after a long day of work and visited with us. She was just as much a delight as Luc was. Charming, open. We had a really good time and we're only sorry our visit was only one night. We do hope to see you both soon! You are welcome in a esbjerg. Ps: the room they hosted us in was very nice and very comfortable. There is an overall warmth with them their home and the whole experience!

It was a really nice couchsurfing experience. I felt like at home with welcolming person, person you can trust in.... and a cute cat! You can speak about everything with Anne and Luc. You can hunt snails and wash a car too ;) 
Thank you again and I hope to see you in Denmark or in France!
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Avrillé, Pays de la Loire, France

text: I had a very nice stay at anne and luc's place. I mad a little bit of garden work while they prepared dinner. They are very nice people talking to and we chatted almost the entire stay. I can only refommened staying with these warm people.

We are grateful to have spent quality time in Saksild in the vast Danish countryside with a kind, warm and welcoming couple! 

Anne is a talented lady who can plant many things in the garden, make jams, freshly pressed apple juice, traditional Danish food. Luc has good sense of humor, knowledgeable about many subjects, and has a talent for making omelettes. There is a intelligent adorable cat in the house. 

Our bedrooms were clean, tidy and we slept very well. The house has many art works and indoor plants. We visited a lovely farm which 
had a fantastic bakery, delicatessen, coffee shop, flowers and farm animals. A modern farm with cows where you could put coins into a machine and get a carton of fresh Milk! Watched an inspiring film in a local cinema. 

We got an authentic Danish experience, learnt many interesting things about Danish culture thanks to Anne and Luc. They were superb hosts who are curious about other cultures, very considerate and happy individuals. Tak Tak!

I've had a really good night Luc and Anne, it's was really good for me to feel home again after being 6 months in Denmark. They made some nice food, we talked about lot of inspiring stuff! You are welcome at home dear Luc and Anne!

Incredible people! Very open and welcoming, with a lot to share. Made us a really nice home cooked meal our first night, with hens from their neighbors. Would very much like to stay again if i head that way!
10/10

Probably one of the souvenirs that i won't forget, Ann & Luc were the most adorable, amazing people i met, they very nice people, to be honest, i'm in lack of words to describe them properly, and the contact was immediat, and they made feel like i'm home with my family, we had long talks about everything, they helped me a lot during my jounrey in Aarhus and Ann showed me some parts of her region that i wouldn't be able to discover if i was there on my own.
This was my first couchsurfing experience, and i couldn't ask for more nice and open minded people like Ann & Luc, and now, i cannot wait to invite them to Algeria, so they can explore a country that weren't in their list, and show them my amazing country and family. <3

We had such a nice time in Saxild. And most of it was due to the very good care that Anne and Luc took of us and the amazing company that they are! I hope that next time, you don't just pass by Antwerp, but take the time and visit us. At least to drink a Tripel from the right glass!

text: Luc and Anne are awesome hosts. They are generous, easygoing, and openminded, curious about life and other people, and interesting to talk with on a host of issues. They have loads of great recommendations for things to do and see in the surrounding area. I particularly enjoyed Luc's stories about living on the Faroe islands, and visiting the lovely cinema where Anna has volunteered for many years, as well as the farm where she grew up, where her sister now runs a bakery, butcher shop, restaurant, cafe and food store full of tasty local products. I'm truly glad I got the chance to meet this couple, and to stay in the wonderfully peaceful and bucolic home they have built together in Saksild. Their cat Mieu is one of the finest felines I've ever encountered. And Anne, you're right, as far as I'm concerned, the beach at Saksild is the finest in Denmark! :) Many thanks to you both. I hope to see you soon.

text:
Peter is an excellent host ( and a good cook to boot ;) This was the first time I have surfed somebody else's couch as I have always hosted before and I couldn't of asked for better first experience. Peter showed me a part of the town that I wouldn't have ever seen on my own and he introduced me to his friends and some very cool music places. This is what the couch surfing is all about, getting exposure to other cultures and learning new things. I highly recommend Peter to anybody who is thinking of visiting Aarhus.

Thanks much Peter for your generosity and hospitality!!! 

Adrian

text:

Michael is a very friendly and polite guest, who not only brings the most awesome Lakrids, but also cooks very nice dinner. And he is the living proof that there are indeed very sociable computer persons! Next time I'm in Denmark, I will take Wheatley with me so he can meet Little Rita ;)

text: Nanna was a very nice guest: we hang out together,  checked out some processions and had some drinks in town,  went for a long walk. Also, at home she was respectful and a good presence.  Best of luck travelling with your boyfriend Nanna!

For my sister and I staying with Nanna was an amazing experience. She's living in a big household with 12 people and they were hosting 5 (maybe 7) couch surfers at the time. All people that we met in the house are really nice. It was a lot of fun. We had a delicious dinner with them and we got a lot of information about Aarhus and Denmark. 
If we are going back to Aarhus we are definitely staying with Nanna.. if she'll take us :p

So many things to write in so small text. Nanna is super easy going and funny person who love to ask many questions (also unusual topics) shes living in big collective  house full of interesting people called Dumpster Paradise. All of people there are super Couchsurfing friendly and positive. It was one of best couchsurfing experience in my life. It was big pleasure to dumpsterdive and cook for all of them xD. I had also possibilities to spend time with other people who were guest same time like me. In the end I've received invitation to visit them again and I'll do it for sure! Miss you guys :* love love love

Nanna is really great host! She not only agreed to host also my 2 friends when they surprisingly showed up in Aarhus, but also tried best to show to us the best dumpsters in the city and woke us up with the training of choir in her house! Totally recommend!

Staying with Nanna was one of my best couchsurfing experiences ever, she and the rest of the kollektiv live in the most beautiful house and everybody is so nice!! Nanna is full of good vibes, really hope to see you again 🌻 thanks for everything 🌈
Thank you Nanna for making my time in Aarhus so amazing! The house is incredible, it really gives you freedom to do anything you like :) I just wish we had more time to hang out!
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Braintree, England, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

text:
Nanna was my first couch surfing host and she raised the bar so high, that my future hosts should really struggle to reach that level :) 
She was so friendly and welcoming, and introduced me to the whole "happy house", she is living in. 
Warmley can recommend her to every future couch surfer :))

She is the most easy-going host you can find. 
Loves speaking English, is an excellent cook - especially Indian inspired cuisine, and loves the city she's living in. 
If she will have time, she'll show you all the best places - and will go exploring with you.

Mikkel was a great guest; very helpful, friendly and flexible. He is a great conversationalist and quite cute when he's asleep. We spent a really nice night in my favorite bar and played kicker and it was really great :)
I hope you had a great night at Lukas place and I hope you had a nice time in Hamburg! I'm sorry I couldn't be the host I wanted to be and thank you for being so patient and helpful :)
Love and hugs!

Sweet and curious young man, very knoledgeable and mature for his age though. I would like to see if you're still fond of concrete in 10 years time :) And when are you going to show me some pictures of yours? I had great time having you. Thanks for being so easy-going and friendly. Be happy!

Mikkel stayed for 2 nights with me and since I was working during the day, we only shared the evenings over dinner at my place. He was a great company, very open-minded, positive, chill person! He was offering help with dishes even and kept the house clean and in order while here. It was very nice and easy talking to him so I would definitely recommend to host him if he needs a place to stay :))

We had a really comfy, chill, fun, winey and musical weekend with Mikkel! First of all he has the perfect curly hair and  with hair down he looks like Simba, Mikkel is very young but he has a strong personality, very thin sense of humor, very great taste of music relating on mine and he is also pro in jenga! We had a nice talks, music sharing and hangouts ^.^ Highly recommend you to host Mikkel if you have the chance to!
Forever young Mikkel!

Mikkel stayed with me for 2 nights and it was good company. We had great talks about everything, and he did not hesitate to express him self. He's a calm guy, and I would definitely recommend him to any other hosts.

Mikkel was a very nice surfer, we exchanged thoughts about our countries and music festivals - something that we both enjoy :) even though we spent little time together, I recommend him because he was very friendly & funny and had no problem adjusting to my busy schedule. 

Hope to see you again, maybe in Denmark! Hugs ✌

(writing the same reference I already published, as I wrote the previous one before the app prompted me to. Woops.)

For our short stay, my boyfriend and I expected a place to sleep and maybe shower. What we got was the hospitality of one of the most wonderful people I've ever met, whose patience lasted through several train delays and cancelations on our end, to then pick us up at the train station way past midnight.

Mikkel is an awesome, pleasant and incredibly friendly person and I almost regret not being able to stay longer and socialize some more. I would come back any time, and certainly host him if the need should arise.

Mikkel was busy arranging a festival so he couldnt host me, but he helped arrange so I could come to the festival and sleep there in the camping area. Really happy I passed by, and met alot of nice people on the festival. Mikkel is really friendly and helpful 👍

Mikkel is a really sympathetic nice guy who made me feel very welcome in the beutiful city Kolding.  We hung out for two days. He is a very good host. We hung out with his friends and watched the world cup. Went to the beach and drank beer at the local pub. Had a really good time. Thank you alot.
I had a great and comfortable stay with Mikkel. He’s interesting, cultural, openminded and suuper friendly.
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark

text: Super nice guy. He offered some food , we talked a lot and so friendly. One very good evening :)
I had a great weekend together with Evelyn and her friend. They are super easy-going and created a nice vibe in my apartment. I can recommend everyone to host the girls.
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark

text: Evelyn is very nice and friendly girl. She stay with me for one night with her Friend. It was very nice time with both of them. We talked a lot and we had some drink together. Unfortunately it was only one night. It was amazing time together. Evelyn always welcome to my place. Good luck 👍
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark

text: She is indipendent, with a great sense of humor, sweet and polite. We had lot of chat as old friends even if we spend just 2 days togheter ans she was kind and friendly with my friends too. My pleasure had host her!

Evelyn is a friendly, open-minded person who's always up for a crazy adventure!  She is fun to be around and both a good listener and a story teller. She's a great cook, especially when it comes to mushrooms, yum! :) You can never go wrong feeding her some chocolate, especially when she's feeling down, even though that doesn't happen very often. Lastly, I am lucky she happens to be my best friend whom I met two years ago and loved ever since! <3
She and her friend Tereza ate very nice and friendly girls. It was lovely hosting them :)

Evelyn-she was untill now,my best visitor.Clean,and respectfully.I receive her from airport,and we visit  one local   bazzar,to see the local color.Next day,we start with rain,but   later,Zeus,stop to be angry,and give to us,one very beautyfull sun,for Halkidiki.And the the day after tomorow,he was more generous.The sea?almost ready  for swiming,the sun more hot...summer time...!!!I  hope,she enjoy her time in our house,the food,and  everything.I  hope,to see her again.Alex
Evelyn and her friends were very friendly, we had a fun night out together and they were easy to get along with. I would host them again.
Evelyn and Tess were really nice people to hang out with. hope you keep travelling and meeting new people, and your gift was really nice :) safe travels!

Evelyn was great! She made my first time being hosted a great experience. She even went the extra mile to offer to host me for another night when my plans fell through. 

I highly recommend her!

Evelyn welcomed us into her house with open arms and warm tea! She was extremely generous with her time, stories and company :-) we only got to stay one night with her, but this overall experience has been truly delightful! 
Hope to cross paths somewhere during future travels! 
Thank you again, 
Morgen and Julie x
I haven’t felt like a coach surfer, he treat my like I was in an Luxury hotel 5 stars and sheeee is really really funny!!!!

we met each other with the connection of my close friend.. we made tea and communed all the night. i liked him .he is smart and smiling and kind person.

nice to meet you.pls call whenever you come to Istanbul

xxx

Sune is a warmhearted friend. Always trying to help friends if solutions are available, he mostly find them. Met Sune many years ago and he surfed at our place in North Karelia and I really like him. Meet him more and more often here and there.

I stayed one night in Sune's place and we had a long conversations about different topics. 
He passionately shared his information about Denmark and some other countries. 
Also he took me and his lovely friend to pick up strawberries in the afternoon. 
His life is simple, calm and relaxed which is getting hard to find these days. 
It definitely was a good and different experience staying with him. 

Thanks for hosting me Sune ☮️☘️🙋🏻🍓☀️
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Newcastle upon Tyne, England, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

text:
I don't even know how many thanks should i say to Sune for everything. I spent one night at his house. First he met me at the station. He made tasty dinner and also i tasted tea and brown norwegian cheese (i think one of his favourite dish:) also he teached me to ride a bicycle (actually i am bad and dangerous bicycle driver:)) he repaired my glasses ( oops now i broke it again)) And he helped me with danish (hope one day i can finally talk in any scandinavian language:)) very kind, nice, interesting person)
 Tusen takk for hjelpen, Sune)
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Saint Petersburg, Saint Petersburg, Russian Federation

text:
We had a great time staying with Sune. He hosted us quite spontaneously and had even time to cook us some delicious pasta :)
We enjoyed the night in his sauna/guest room very much, thank you again for the hospitality.
Sune is a great host. He helped finding my ways in the town, borrowed me a bicycle and an umbrella on the other day.  Also he is a great cook and his house got that hygge. Thank you :)

Hello,

We had great time at Sunes place,. Friendly atmosphere, good transformer sauna with quiet location close to a lake.

Thank you for hospitality.
See you next time :)
We spent a really good time with Sune, thank you for everything 😊 my experience in your sauna was amazing ! Thank you

text:
My dear Sune, how I can say thank you for all the things you gave us .. i think - No words .. but for sure I can say you are going to be in my heart for ever :)
When my boyfriend and me arrive to Sune's home, we feel immediately so at home, he prepare for us a couple of times a lovely dinner, but more than that he listen our experiences, doubts, plans and he gave us advices and a super smile :)
We enjoy a lot to ride around the city with your bicycles, but not so much the cold hahaha .. and also the warm sauna!
Gracias eternamente por todo el amor que nos diste, deseo que el español y el esperanto lleguen pronto a fluir en ti
response: {'id': '17130118', 'text': ':-) Yes,  Words, they are sometimes limited, but with you, they are flowing while friendship are growing, and I for sure got inspired to let also Español flow a bit (a lot) more, probably via Esperanto shortcuts. \r\nThanx for nice company, deep Movie, your first Sauna-experience (next time maybe including cold swim at the local winther-beach-sauna, hehe), and all the stories from your beautiful country, culture and Life. text:

I would absolutely recommend others to welcome him to their home, and I would be happy to host Peter again.
response: {'id': '9723300', 'text': 'Anja was very quick to respond to my emergency couch request, and that truly saved my day! Her apartment is really nice, and she has the cutest little dog. text: Peter hosted me for 3 days when I was in aarhus ,Denmark. He is very nice and fantastic CS!! He showed me and another German girl around the whole aarhus and we ate so delicious food!! Peter ,you are always welcome if you travel to China and I hope you can sell your sweet house with a good price!

text:
I've surfed Peter's couch twice now - basically the plan is to stop by at least for a coffee every time I drive through Denmark :-)
He's a laid-back guy with a nice sense of humor. See you in Denmark or Norway!
response: {'id': '8637110', 'text': "I only hosted Suse for one night, while she was traveling through Denmark, on her way back to Norway. A shame really.. you would have been welcome to stay longer, and explore our little corner of Scandinavia - feel free to stop by another time!\r\nOr perhaps I'll see you on a small island somewhere? ;-)", 'createdDate': '2011-10-11T14:39:13Z', 'experience': 'positive', 'relationshipType': 'host', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '1876523'}, 'from': {'id': '1921337', 'publicName': 'Peter Bak Petersen', 'publicAddress': {'id': '4626459', 'description': 'Hammel, Favrskov Municipality, Denmark'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/images.couchsurfing.us/CVL0LMK/11525419_l_781bc14538d0b8de333fe3c807e8bdfd.jpg', 'status': 'maybe', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

text: Peter is the perfect guy to help you in a real Danish experience. In addition to show me all the crazy wildlife, he also prepared me some real Danish food eaten during his time as a student :) As a good eater I enjoyed everything and all the drinks, of course... We also had some good conversation and a lot of relaxing and funny moments. I also do hope to see him again some day :)

It was nice from Peter to host us, although we are Germans ;) 
so from that you know that he is quite tolerant.
The stay at yours was fun, we enjoyed hanging out with a nerd, who exploits Germany for it's alcohol.
Thanks to you we finally had our european road trip hehe..

So if you're into beer, muesli and power-protein-food, you totally should stay at Peters!

You were the perfect host, thanks for showing us around in Aarhus and the countryside!
We will come back when there are open shops and students hanging out, we actually have to come back anyway to graduate in Denmark ;)
We would offer you to stay at our place in Germany, but as we know how much you love this country, we won't do that!
Thanks again for the good times,
Alice & Marie
response: {'id': '7711813', 'text': "Marie and Alice are two really nice girls, and absolutely no problem to host. My guestroom is more tidy now, than before they arrived :-)\r\n\r\nBeing German, they are of course also trying to take over the world, but if all German people are like Marie and Alice, perhaps it isn't such a bad thing after all.. You're welcome back in Aarhus any time!", 'createdDate': '2011-06-29T08:05:42Z', 'experience': 'positive', 'relationshipType': 'host', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '2903716'}, 'from': {'id': '1921337', 'publicName': 'Peter Bak Petersen', 'publicAddress': {'id': '4626459', 'description': 'Hammel, Favrskov Municipality, Denmark'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/images.couchsurfing.us/CVL0LMK/11525419_l_781bc14538d0b8de333fe3c807e8bdfd.jpg', 'status': 'maybe', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

text: This guy is very approachable and very generous. We strolled around the city of Aarhus and after went straight to his place for dinner. We talked and discussed alot of things such travel plans and history of his country. This guy is well mannered and kind... Thanks Peter for the good time. Cheers and hope to see you again in my future trip!

text: Mikkels and Rikke are friendly,and they have two cute boys. we have dinner with them,after dinner we have a dessert  time and a good talking. They told us many interesting things about Danmark,we are very lucky we could stay with Mikkel's and Rikke.
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Taitung City, Taiwan Province, Taiwan, Republic Of China

text: Mikkel and Rikke are a sweet and generous couple! Great conversations and fun games together. They hosted me in Aarhus and we had a cultural dinner exchange. It was nice to learn to make frikadella from scratch. We also went to explore a danish glass museum and had hot chocolate together (yummy, danish hot chocolate is simply the best. All the best for your Thai trip! If you need anything dont hesitate to drop me a line. Cheers
response: {'id': '6354709', 'text': 'Melissa stayed with us for 3 days and she is a wonderfull person. text: It was such a great experience meeting  Frederik ! Not only because he s a perfect guest but also because he is very friendly interested in many different fields and curious to discover the city and go out. Hope  i ll see him again!

Fred is what legends are made of. Very new to CS this was his first CS experience and he passed it with flying colours. 
The first evening we just lounged in the balcony having intense discussions. The second day we visited Monaco the old city in the morning. Fred made a lovely meal. In the evening we visited Monaco with a yet another CS and did some bar hopping. 
Fred has an awesome sense of humour and you cannot get bored in his company. 
I hope we do meet again as Fred and West both came as CS but leave as friends. Please do not hesistate to host Fred. 
Hope to meet you soon mate

When you travel solo, you often don't know how the day will turn out: what you will do, where you will go, or even if you will meet anybody new. Coming to Aarhus for a short stay, Frederick was what made my time there memorable. Meeting in the evening we bought food to cook together and sat on his Sail Boat in the harbor. Sharing drinks and good conversations, we worked on his boat and enjoyed the evening. You couldn't ask for better! Frederick is fun, kind, and insightful. He offers a great perspective and values hearing the perspectives and views others hold. If you come to Aarhus and are looking for a new person to meet and spend time with, Frederick is the one to do it with!

I had the pleasure to host Daniel and Jonatan's  first couchsurfing expirience and it was completely amazing to meet and share those moments with them. Was a short stay/meeting, but it was clear to see how good people they really are. These guys are incredibly calm and, at the same time, fun to be with, up to hang out, have some beers and enjoy a good night out, just like we did!
Their faith is also remarkable once you meet them, what mixed with their equally open minds, guarantee some good, deep and thoughtful conversations about likewise or different opnions.
Give yourselves a chance to meet Daniel and Jonatan, and I'm pretty sure it won't be a regret.
Nice guy living with some cool friends - definitely would stay again!

Robin is a real cool guy .living and learning from his travel. we had good conversation beertasting !
It's funny how two of my CS housemates received a request from him as well... I guess you chose our home to be you home in Brussels !
response: {'id': '12839200', 'text': "Nikko is a very chill, very awesome and crazy talented guy. We had some really great conversations, and I'd love to have some of those conversations again over a beer. Preferably Belgian beer, but if you're in Denmark sometime, we can probably find some Danish beer that isn't just Carlsberg ;)", 'createdDate': '2013-04-14T10:42:43Z', 'experience': 'positive', 'relationshipType': 'surf', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '1164957'}, 'from': {'id': '5354165', 'publicName': 'Robin Christensen', 'publicAddress': {'id': '8059255', 'description': 'Aarhus, Central Denmark Region, Denmark'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/images.couchsurfing.us/10XGEUXK/27544719_l_5397fb61d78db187b997cac7ab88d6d8.jpg', 'status': 'maybe', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

it was a great weekend, very good exchange

text:
Robin was a pleasure to host as my first surfer!!
I was quite nervous for my first guest but Robin put me instantly at ease and together over a couple of beers we uncovered one of life's greatest secrets. I hope I showed you bits of London you hadn't seen on previous visits, sorry I couldn't be around more if you ever turn up here again don't hesitate to get in contact.
response: {'id': '12535390', 'text': "Adam is awesome, and I really enjoyed uncovering the mysteries of the universe over a few beers! text: Robin impressed me by choosing the Faroes, Iceland and Scotland as destinations for his long-planned winterly after-school trip across Europe. Glasgow welcomed him with a unique Scottish blizzard, so Lena and me tried our best to make him feel comfortable afterwards. During his 6-night stay he always was polite and open for every crazy idea whether it was a day trip to Skye (12 hours on the bus) or Japanese art house cinema at the other end of the city. We also had an enriching after-stay conversation already. I'm looking forward on keeping in touch with him via the tumblrs, soundclouds and facebooks of this web.
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Douglas, Isle of Man, Isle of Man
response: {'id': '12458545', 'text': "Martin is a good guy, and during my stay with him and his girlfriend in their apartment in Glasgow, they really made me feel welcome and helped me out with what to do and see in Glasgow, while I was there. text:
Magical guest! With her you can feel strong and positive energy flowing all around. Perfect companion for any kind of conversations, and i guess for all kind of activities as well. Super cheerful lady with a lot of depth inside. :) And one more word - alive! In this way Veronika makes alive everything what is around and even impossible looks possible again! :) 
See you somewhere under the moon!

I hosted Veronika for a couple of nights in Hamburg. From the very first message she sent me, I could see she is worth to spend time with and I wasn't disappointed. She is thoughtful, mature, progressive, independent and still casual looking young girl. 
We had the chance to have some deeper conversations. I would definitely recommend her as a guest.

I hosted Veronika a few days in Amsterdam. She is a wonderful human; adventurous, generous, with a sense for aesthetics and a curious mind. 

Veronika asks questions nobody asked you before and tells you things you didn't know before. If you like conversations, you will like Veronika :-)

Hope you enjoyed the rest of your trip in NL! Always welcome again :-)

P.S.: Tell her to make you coffee :-)

Special and smart

Will see on the Playa in 2018
column18: {'text': 'See you there! \r\nBest wishes and many thanks', 'author': {'id': '1007286103', 'publicName': 'Veronika Slachtova', 'publicAddress': {'id': '13149928', 'description': 'Aarhus, Denmark'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/ht-images.couchsurfing.com/u/1007286103/9ab1372b-95a9-40f5-a07e-be3695b6b6db', 'status': 'maybe', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'createdDate': '2017-07-17T21:06:07Z'}

text: Veronika is curious, wants to learn from others and get inspired. She takes a lot of knowledge and is willing to share beautiful stories! Usually I only host for a few days, but I wish I could have host this girl for longer! She is creative and fun. I was enjoying the fact that she enjoyed hanging out with my friends too. She challenged me to buy art supplies because I wanted to do that already for a long time! And guess what... I did it after a week when she sent me a reminder and I had a lot of fun drawing already. Girl, you ROCK!!! Come back one day! Cheeers!

Veronika stayed at our apartment for only two nights during the week so we unfortunately haven't spent much time together. She is friendly, curious and easygoing, it was really nice to have her as our guest!

Veronika is an incredible woman. Although young by pure numbers, she is a very wise woman. Her thinking far surpasses her age and is far ahead of her times. She is very confident, head strong and her personality exudes a lot of positivity. Her mind is always deliberating and contemplating on deep and profound topics like spirituality, philosophy, physics etc. She is a woman of varied and far ranging interests. Her spectrum of knowledge is quite impressive and her ability of self reflection, very charming. It is a shame I got to host her only for a night. The amount of talking we did and the fun we had was boundless. She is very inquisitive by nature and has a very open mind. She is a conversationalist at heart and a rather excellent one at that. She came as a stranger and left as a very good friend. If ever one has the opportunity to host her, one ought not to miss it.
Veronika was supposed to stay over with a friend, but unfortunately I had to cancel because of a last minute business trip. you are welcome anytime :-)
column18: {'text': 'Giorgio was very kind while we were arranging our stay, hopefully next time  nothing will fall in the way :)', 'author': {'id': '1007286103', 'publicName': 'Veronika Slachtova', 'publicAddress': {'id': '13149928', 'description': 'Aarhus, Denmark'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/ht-images.couchsurfing.com/u/1007286103/9ab1372b-95a9-40f5-a07e-be3695b6b6db', 'status': 'maybe', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'createdDate': '2016-03-14T03:09:07Z'}

text:
Veronica is a wonderful girl energetic and enterprising . I met her and her best friend ( his mother ) masha a beautiful woman private and helpful. They were in Milan to see the expo and during that time I was working a lot .
pity he did not have time to share more things
I ate waffer your country with my children , thank you
you are two wonderful people and I hope to see you soon in Milan or in Slovakia

response: {'id': '10544142', 'text': 'Such a nice person! Selim is very nice to talk with and hang out with. I was so sad that we didnt spend more days. It was so relaxing and fun at same time. text:
Mads really enjoyed his visit with us. We got along immediately.
He did appreciate our advice and saw interesting things a normal tourist misses.
He received many views of our country and the region. He purchased some "ancient" and we spent much of an evening trying to learn how to test silver and trying to determine their authenticity.
He was a lot of fun and he enjoyed our crazy dog and our strange couching room.

Christian stayed with me for 11 nights.  Even though he is new to couch surfing, he knows how to be a great guest.  He always cleaned up after himself, and he was super helpful with chores such as loading and emptying the dishwasher.  It was really easy communicating with him...it was like talking to a friend that you have known for years.  We were able to go to bars together, try different restaurants, and I also took him to a house party with my friends, and my friends were raving about how cool he was to interact with.  Overall, Christian is an awesome couch surfer.  If you have the chance to host him, you should.  You will be singing his praises too.  I highly recommend him!!!

Ah, so what should I start with?
We spent a couple of days with Nick, and I had feeling that I knew him all my life. Great guest - nice, polite, friendly, flexible, thoughtful......
Great travel companion - was funny to use together almost every possible transport in Ukraine - train during day when it is incredibly hot, night train when you do not have proper tickets, bus where you cannot get out untill the last stop, so then you should take a tram to go back... :)
Nick shared his amazing stories and photos. He is really knowledgeable.
You should be in our team for pab-quiz games.
Now you know my hometown almost as good, as I do. And I hope you are not afraid of all my relatives (I am sure you remember who is who) ;) 
Ah, and yes, next time we to go to mountains at least one of us should check the route.
Thank you for showing me this amazing place with Uzbek cuisine. And for not breaking my bones. :D
You know that you are always welcome in my hometown (at least because you know where is the key ), and in Lviv, and in Kyiv, and.... 
Vi ses!

Nick is an awesome guy. The kind of person you feel comfortable with from the very first second. We had a great conversation which I really enjoyed, I'm sure Nick is someone I'd love to chat with for hours and hours. It's a pity we didn't have time to hang out together coz he had his plans changed and left earlier. I highly recommend hosting or surfing with Nick :) I really hope we will keep in touch and hang out together in Kiev or elsewhere. Cheers! 😊
This is my second time hosting Nick and it is always a pleasure. You are welcome back any day!

Nick is one of the coolest guys ever!! Soooo friendly and happy and open. My roommates and I are so happy we got the chance to meet him and spend time with him. Tacos and ice cream was so fun and we can't wait to do that again! Thanks for the great convos and refreshing perspectives. You are a pleasure to host and are always welcome here my friend!! :)
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Venice Beach, Los Angeles, CA, USA

text: Nick is fun outgoing guy, very flexible, easy-going couchsurfer to have a laugh with :)
Ohh, Nick was playing hard to get :D friendly, easy-going and funny guy. Me and all my friends enjoyed his company, you won't regret a minute spent with him as well, I guarantee it.;)

Such a fun guy Nick is!!! What I really liked about him is the positive energy that comes out and the way he thinks about things around us. Way ahead comparing with his age. Serious thoughts, with serious standings, and still cool, chill and fun regarding loosed things. Willing to explore the nature, and that is why he got lost :) but all went good and he found his way home 
Nick, I wish you all the luck in the world, success and hopefully we will meet each other again.
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Skopje, Skopje, Macedonia (the former Yugoslav Republic of)

text:
Hosting Nick was a very enjoyable experience. We didn't get to hang out for too long because of my exams the morning after, but the few hours spent talking and playing cards were enough to make the best out of it. My roommate and I enjoyed his colorful and cheery company so much and we were honored to have him as a guest in our little apartment! 
A really nice and fun guy!

First up, Nick’s a good bloke. No, actually he a fucking good bloke. In Australia, that’s about as high a compliment you give a man.  At first I didn’t have room for him, but he persisted in annoying the shit out of me to stay, so I thought, stuff it, I’ll get this bloke in just to stop him stalking me.  Hahahaha. But I really did wanted to meet him as well. We spent lots of time talking and discussing all sorts of stuff. It was refreshing to be able to have different points of view and discuss it without the other person getting upset or argumentative. I really enjoyed our talks.  Everyone who met him here really enjoyed spending time with him. But I guess with the number of references he has, this shouldn’t be a surprise.  Hopefully Nick will pass this way again next year and we will get to have a good time together again. Nick is a thorough gentleman, trustworthy and genuine. While he was here there was a newbie Couchsurfing girl and he looked after her just like I did. I appreciated knowing that she was in good hands with him.

very awesome guy - well traveled and has great stories. very keen to lend and hand and is up for anything from a quiet night in to partying to the late hrs :D was sad to see him go and wish him well on his travels

text: Nick initially requested 2 nights and ended up here for 7.  This alone reflects how easy going and warm hearted he is.  While he was here I hosted at least 5 other surfers and he fitted in with them all.  We managed to do a fair bit during his early stay (I was on vacation) so we enjoyed much of what Maroochydore and it's surrounds have to offer.  He interacted well with everyone we met and together we made new friends.  I wish him well on his current life journey and hope that it provides for him, the opportunity and direction he is yet to discover.  Andy

text:
Hosting Nick has been an extremely positive experience.  You cannot ask for a more genuine, kind, and intelligent person.  

Although just having literally a day in Philadelphia, Nick masterfully incorporated me in his plans.  We hung out together, cooked a delicious meal together, and enjoyed chatting about many varied topics.   Nick has a very smart way of thinking about the world.  I really enjoyed walking to the Liberty Bell with him, pointing out points of interest, and sharing my city with him.  I was truly disappointed in seeing him go so soon.  

Nick, thanks for allowing me to host you.  If Nick contacts you on his amazing trip around the globe, do host him or if nothing else, hang out with him, you won't be disappointed.
response: {'id': '17457189', 'text': "Steven is the kind of host that makes you feel sad - sad that you didn't plan more time in Philly and with him. He a genuine good person, interesting conversationist, laid back and trustworthy as hell. I could probably write a lot more - but trust me on this one, you want him as a host or as a surfer!\n\nI saw the Liberty Bell, the surroundings and the Rocky-stuff - and even though I'm a big Rocky-fan, then my Philly-experience is topped by my stay at Steven!", 'createdDate': '2015-04-25T21:41:55Z', 'experience': 'positive', 'relationshipType': 'other', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '1000073049'}, 'from': {'id': '335093', 'publicName': 'Nick Steenberg', 'publicAddress': {'id': '3040241', 'description': 'Aarhus, Central Denmark Region, Denmark'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/images.couchsurfing.us/28QNBS5/8576726_l_74f2f957552429d35ae670ab80a1c58c.jpg', 'status': 'yes', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

text: NICK!  Nick was a great couch surfer - so much so that now I am convinced that Denmark may have the greatest pool of couch surfers in the whole world!  It was a positive experience for me and I really hope to see Nick again!  Via con Dios, brother!
response:
{'id': '17457160', 'text': "I was fortunate enough to be hosted by Mike for two nights.

There's quite a bunch of nudists on couchsurfing, some of them have dodgy profiles and dodgy intentions - sometimes very nice profiles and dodgy intentions. Everybody should be precautions in that matter.

With that said - I've never done nudity before being at Mikes place, but he was very, very considerate and he used a lot of his time before my arrival to make sure, I understood the conditions and was very open towards questions and really wants you to feel secure.

And I did - it's always a little awkward in the beginning due to own insecurities but this dude is so easy going and laid back around it all and I had a really nice stay - the only bad part was that I couldn't stay longer or spend more time with Mike - we still have a lot to talk about :)

Until next time - alt godt fra undertegnede Danmark :)", 'createdDate': '2015-04-25T21:32:05Z', 'experience': 'positive', 'relationshipType': 'other', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '1000865650'}, 'from': {'id': '335093', 'publicName': 'Nick Steenberg', 'publicAddress': {'id': '3040241', 'description': 'Aarhus, Central Denmark Region, Denmark'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/images.couchsurfing.us/28QNBS5/8576726_l_74f2f957552429d35ae670ab80a1c58c.jpg', 'status': 'yes', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

text:
Nick made some major error during his initial contact, which i forgave him easily because i really liked his profile! Actually I had to kick out another surfer to make space for him :P

I had accepted his emergency request and hosted him 2 nights during new year, as well as hosted him a second time middle of January. On arrival he bought some beers and then we went to the Couchsurfing New Year Party and Khao San road. Another time we went to the floating market.

Nick is a smart guy, polite, funny and friendly. He is the 'perfect' couchsurfer and i'm glad he was here. Also he ate (nearly) everything i had cooked, haha :-))

Thanks again for joining us, see ya soon!
response: {'id': '16926054', 'text': 'Oh man, oh man, oh man. Hayko is quite the charismatic host. Even though I screwed up regarding the tricky way of contacting him the right way, I was allowed to come to his place. Actually twice - because he chose to also save my New Years and find room for me in his living room which I really appreciate. Easy to talk to, fun and humorous, great GreenCurryChef and just a standup guy with a lot of positivity to give to the world. text:
I hosted Nick for two nights, he's a good guest and left the place clean.

Aaand... what else?! He's very perspicacious when it comes to analyzing portraits and people's mind. I still don't really know what he does for a living, but well, he's alive, that's the point. text:
Nick is such a nice friendly guy! I wish we had spent more time together though, since we both were quite busy. But I really had a very good stay at his place (which is top!) and totally recommend him. Also his roomie is lovely.
Thank you again for everything, let's hang out when you come to CPH :)

Nick is a very friendly and approachable guy with a lot of experience and cool stories. He made me feel like I'm home right away and I enjoyed every minute of staying at his place. Nick's flatmates are also really nice and helpful! 

Thank you for hosting me Nick, you're more than welcome to stay at our place in Plymouth if you'd ever like to explore southwest England :) I'm sure we'll see each other again one day.
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Plymouth, England, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

text:
As everyone else has said, Nick is just the best! 

I had a great time hanging out with him as he's super easy to talk to and hilarious. 

He had a lot of great tips about what to see and do in town, and lent me an extra key so I could come and go as I wished. 

I hope we'll meet again someday soon. :)

Nick is super friendly, easy to talk to, thoughtful and generous! He really made sure that we were comfortable and had all the things that travellers often want/need. He also had heaps of tips about what to do and how to get there, but also stressed how important it was to not travel with too much pressure on how much and what you should do. My friend Lucy and I had never couchsurfed before and as two young females were a bit sceptical, but Nick made it really easy for us and was an all round winner, we always felt safe and comfortable! Thank you so much for the Danish treats for the bus ride and riding your bike on a cold Saturday morning to give them to us, it really made our day :) Good luck with your future ventures, never settle for boring, and see you in Hobart! Annie and Lucy :)

Although this was my first Couchsurfing experience ever, I think that it isn't even possible for the host to be better than this. Nick was very understanding about my situation and the fact that I had no references, which was very nice of him. He is fun and talkative and helps with anything you have to deal with. It was a pleasure to meet him and to stay at his place, which, because of his attitude, really felt like home. I would recommend him to anyone and I certainly hope we'll meet someday again.

Nick is a guy with many stories and experiences to share, his profile speaks for itself, it was an honour to be his guest :)
I requested to stay for one night and he let me stay for one night more :) (supernice of you, thanks again!!) even if we didn't hang out together (he had to work) we had a beer and nice chats, talking to him was like talking to an old friend. I felt like I was at home. 
I will definitely come back to Aarhus and I hope he will come to visit me sooner or later, maybe in Italy :)
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark

text: Nick was a kind and hospitable host. We were both kind of busy and I only stayed one night, so we didn't get to know each other well, but he seemed like an open-hearted and easygoing person.

Nick hosted me for 1 night in Aarhus. We changed a few messages until I reached his house, he was total flexible and there was that night also hosted a girl from Singapore, which made  the visit of Aarhus more interesting. He is an uncomplicated guy and experienced in Couch Surfing. We spent a few hours in his house together sharing CS Experiences and he gave us a few tips about what and how to visit a few places in his city. Denmark and Aarhus were nice, the weather was not so gut,but anyway, what to say about this guy, awesome!! Honestly, if you visit Aarhus contact him and if you receive a request from them, don´t hesitate hosting him, really nice, you will not regret!! All the best for you, my friend!! We wait for you in Hamburg!! Or I will be there in the near future!! Cheerzz!! :-)

Saying that Nick is an amazing host would be an understatement! He accepted me eventhough I sent my request at the last minute and he had already agreed to host another surfer, and I'm truly grateful for that. He even came to fetch me from the train station to his house, which was fortunately just a stone's throw away, and made me feel right at home! He's so trusting and gave me a key to his place, which helped a lot since I didn't have data to stay in contact all the time. He's also a great conversationalist and it was definitely fascinating to pick his brain on his vast travel experiences! I felt really comfortable and safe staying with Nick, and I hope to meet him again somewhere around the world, as "it's a small world after all"! 😊 See ya when I see ya!
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark

text:
Nick is very much the ideal host. Trusting, interesting, friendly, nice, whatever positive words you can think of probably fits him and I love that we're so much alike in the way that we think, it's very nice to find someone who's easy going and super chill about everything, especially when you yourself are that way, we just clicked(to me at least :p) I loved our night in watching Pixar, nothing gets better than that! And thanks for all the Danish dessert and breakfast, such a wonderful time and thanks for your thoughtfulness. Would love to be back, even if it means crashing your friend's couch haha! 

Hugs! 
Annie

I really enjoyed my time with Nick! I stayed with him only for one night but I guess it was enough to learn how sweet this Viking is;)) We hung out in the city, talked for hours, watched a movie...
I hope to see him again. Perhaps in Wonderland or on a Pirates Ship...lol!

Cheers man!
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Tehran, Tehran Province, Iran (Islamic Republic of)

text: I went to Aarhus for a two day seminar and wanted to try couchsurfing in my own country for the first time. And I must say that I had a really nice experience staying with Nick.  He is a super friendly guy with a very comfortable couch. He was very quick in responding to my request and messages and I felt the good vibes around him from the first moment. I came quite late in the evening but we still had a cup of tea and a nice talk. :-) I enjoyed staying at his place and hope to see him some other time - maybe in my city next time... ;-)
Nick is a great guy, giving me the chance to get experienced in couchsurfing. He made me feel home right away, gave me advices and helped me planing my next trip.
