text:
My friend and I stayed with Monta and her flatmates in their lovely flat in Aarhus for an evening. Although she was working until late that day and had commitments the following morning, she accepted to host us which was an incredibly kind and thoughtful gesture, and really shows her great generosity and willingness to help.

Monta and her flatmates understood our needs as travellers and did everything they could to make our stay as confortable and pleasant as possible. They were incredibly welcoming, helpful and attentive with us, making us feel like at home as soon as we met. We had a terrific time together while having dinner as we shared a tone of stories and anecdotes about our travels and experiences couchsurfing that made the whole evening fly by!

Because of their wonderful attention and marvellous kindness, I highly recommend Monta and any of her flatmates either as a host or guest, and would be more than happy to stay with them again.
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: London, England, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

text: It was a pleasure to be a guest in Monta’s flat, she and her flatmates (and her cousin that was also visiting her) are very nice and funny people. They were totally ok with our schedule and didn’t mind that we slept until late or we arrive to the flat late in the night even if they didn’t want to go out. If you are planning to visit Aarhus I totally recommend to stay in her place.
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, España

text: Monta and her flatmates Annija and Villads are super friendly and nice guys ! We drank together at home, and they told me many tips about Aarhus. They live at a cozy flat in a beautiful neighborhood, which is also easily accessible to the city center. They were a little bit busy when I was staying there but well took care of me. I would definitely love to hang out with them again if we have a chance, and also happy to host them if they come to Japan.

Monta has the same passion to see every country as me and has already got a lot of stories to tell! Her and her flatmates were all super friendly and fun, taking me to a party and recommending things in Aarhus. Can't wait to show her around the more fun parts of London some time soon :)
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: London, England, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

text:
Monta and her flatmates were very nice with me in every moment, they gave me tips to visit the sights in Aarhus and also we share several moments together. I'll never forget EscoBar haha.
So I definitely recommend to stay in Monta's home, you are gonna have the best experience with these guys, at least for me was one of the best experience through Couchsurfing.
I just hope to see you again around Europe or South America :D
Jeanne was a nice guest. We hung out in Hollywood and Griffith and had some good conversation. Would recommend her to any host!

Had a great time with Jeanne.  We went to rooftops and danced on one of the nights with jeanne and some of my friends and the night was magical.  Had a great time.  Jeanne is very flexible and cool to be around with.  She is definitely worth hosting.  If you ever want to come back your welcome here in LA.

Jeanne... it’s kinda hard finding the right words to explain how much of a lovely experience it has been having her at my place...
It all started from the moment she brought this positive vibe with her & was lovable enough to not just make herself at home but part of the family as well & that’s exactly what makes her the rarest of the gems we can barely find around ourselves & can just completely connect with... & I was lucky enough to find her through the click of a button...
We pretty much spent all our time together & we just couldn’t have enough of San Francisco..! 
Before leaving, she made sure to rewrite my definition of pure happiness by having the “Caramel Popcorn 🍿” for the very first time in her life (yes that’s true!) & the happiness on her face at that very moment made me realize all over again that how important & precious even the little things are in our lives... 
Jeanne, just to let you know, as long as I am in San Francisco, you have a place here called home...!

I loved having Lorenz stay with me. He's very friendly and personable. We had several meals together, went to an NFL game together, watched several more football games on TV and hit a few of the major sites of NYC together.

I enjoyed spending time with Lorenz and he is always welcome back at my place anytime.
She is great girl and  her frinds the are so nice  I hope to met jasmin  her  little petra jordan again.

First of all:

Jasmin is frekin' GREAT. ☺ 

I'm thankful for the chance to meet this awesome and inspiring person. 
I hope to meet her again someday - would host her anyday.. Would love to get to know her furthermore. 
Jasmin, thank you a whole bunch for the short amount of time with you. I wish you all the best. ♥
Markus is a very nice and knowledgeable  guy. Clean, respectful and helpful. We had dinner together and had a great conversation on a wide range of topics. Would be happy to host him again!

Simon and his Swiss friend Matthias had to share our living room with two Americans. I very much liked this multinational company. He played us songs on a small guitar. You won't expect such a manly voice from this skinny boy =)))

text:
I hosted Simon almost a week, his friend Robert during the week few times and even their friend Keske for few days. They all were fantastic ....together ...separately ...just perfect guests all the time. Super fun, great talks. Cooked EXCELLENT dinner and at the end of they stay cleaned so I thought it is not my apartment.
Good luck with your travells and project.

It was really a pleasure to get to know Simon and his friend. From the first moment I enjoyed that both were really open minded and shared our appartment as we would have been roommates. We always try that every guest feels at home. Even  when we were a bit absent with renovating our appartment we had enough time to get to know each other. I am looking forward to meet Simon again in India or Denmark or somewhere else.
And one advise let him make some bread and you will have some fun.

The last 2 days Simon und Robert have been our guests. It was a very positive and awe-inspiring experience to hear the stories of them both. On their way from Denmark to India by bike they stopped by in Greifswald too. They stayed for two nights. The first night they both slept on our couch. Unfortunatly that was not possible the second night. But as they did an unplaned stopover in my office anyway - to update and work on their tourdiary and blog >www.robertoglykkebybike.dk< - they simply stayed in my office for the night. They both are extremely likeable and down-to-earth,  openminded and eager for knowledge. Whenever they stop by and ask for a stay at yours, accommodate them and listen to their stories. Sure you will be impressed! Wish you all the best in the world and a successful journey full of events. I'm sure we will meet again. At least in Potsdam in a year at Roberts new caravan! *bigsmile*
response: {'id': '1562667', 'text': "I and my travel companion Surfed two nights at Gritt and Ronnie's place, or more precisely, places. They were very helpfull from the start. First of all they answered very fast, and they offered that we could put our bicycles in their basement, they were curious to know about our tour to India, and our bikes, as They do alot of sports themselves. Their couch gave us a really great and deep rest. Generally speaking, it was so easy to feel at home at their place. They are open, humorous and full of good tips and tricks. We had two really good days in Greifswald, thanks to Gritt and Ronnie. Thanks for all, food and especially the shelter at your office, but also the tip about the old Rocket-test-center in Peenemünde, it is indeed recomendable, as is a surf at Gritt und Ronnie's place . Good Luck with the Mini Triathlon on Saturday! You made our trip a lot easier\r\n\r\nSimon og Robert.   ", 'createdDate': '2008-08-08T12:01:33Z', 'experience': 'positive', 'relationshipType': 'surf', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '314659'}, 'from': {'id': '611918', 'publicName': 'Simon Lykke Justesen', 'publicAddress': {'id': '3317041', 'description': 'Beder, Aarhus Municipality, Denmark'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/images.couchsurfing.us/43SYJUA/12840003_l_4b09858757ed4ca3896a5295875ef63a.jpg', 'status': 'yes', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

text: Malthe was a great host! He picked me up and dropped me off at the train station and lent me his extra bike to get around the city. He also showed me around a few areas in the city one day. He’s very easy going and if you need something, he’s got it! :)

He was very polite, thoughtful and trustworthy. He was willing to make a conversations and share experiences and knowledge, at the same   time he gave me adequate personal space when I want. I wish I could stay longer with him.
Malthe is an amazing host! He picked up me and my friend from the train station, gave us his bikes and made our stay wonderful! Thank you for all and you’re welcome to Poland or Ukraine :)

Where to start.. I know many people write references for hosts they described as really specially and extraordinary good hosts and I would like to go beyond that and state that I believe Malthe is an especially elite host. Not only was he extremely thoughtful and respectful, he also always double checked with me about everything and said from the start that he does not expect me to include him in my exploring of the city but he is happy to join. He is very intelligent and is a very good conversation partner that you can intensively talk to for hours. But also it was really not uncomfortable just to sit in silence with him for a while.We took a trip around the city and a beautiful national parc and the beach with his car and one night we cooked dinner together which was delicious 😋 I had a clean room with a very cosy mattress and he gave me a set of keys and a bike (very convenient for the city). Malthe, you are a very good person! Thousand thanks, see you next time!Always welcome here😊

Malthe is a friendly, helpful and nice person. He lent a bike to me which was a great help to explore the city faster/better. He always answered very fast to me which is also a good experience for me.
I arrived after 8pm on Friday so both of us was a bit tired and at the next day he also had a program so we can not have a lot of time to speak with each other but we had some short, but interested conversations. His place is minimalistic which is rare but I really liked it. :-)
I am definitely recommend to you to stay by him if you can!
It was a pleasure to meet you. You are always welcome in Hungary! :-)

Staying with Malthe is an awesome experience! He is one of the best hosts that one can imagine, helpful, thoughtful, kind and intelligent to have interesting conversations with. His place showcases his minimalistic lifestyle and excellent taste, not to mention it's not far away from the city centre. 

We watched football match together and get super excited when Denmark made it to the World Cup. Malthe also drove me to deer park and Moesgaard museum which has worth checking exhibitions and cool architecture. There were several nights that I went out  with my old friends in Aarhus and Malthe is okay with that. To express my gratitude, I made delicious Thai curry for us. I hope it would be a beautiful memory for both of us.

Malthe is not just a one time host to me but a lifelong friend. If you want a comfortable stay and also a genuine friend from Aarhus, don't hesitate to stay with Malthe.
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Hong Kong Island, Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, China

text:
Malthe is a really nice, friendly and relaxed guy who is very helpful and carrying. He helped me changing to his place very last minute and I really can recommend to stay with him. We hang out, had good conversations and I felt very comfortable at his place.  Just the perfect spot to have a good time in Aarhus. 
The flat and the guest room are clean and close to the center. A supermarket and very good bakery are around the corner.So, go to Aarhus and please meet Malthe. 

For me, it was a real pleasure meeting you and you are always welcome to Hamburg!  See you

When we arrived at Malthe's place we were exhausted and needed somewhere to rest and relax. His apartment was the perfect place to do that since he is a very mellow, quiet but friendly person. Malthe has a very kind soul! We shared good meals, indulged in thought-provoking conversations, enjoyed very good coffee, and were mesmerized by a wonderful view of Aarhus. 
Tuning into our need for nature, he took us to three different spots where we could enjoy being surrounded by cute deer and also the seaside. 
We are grateful with CouchSurfing for giving us this new friend whom otherwise we would have never met. 
Thank you for everything Malthe!
Until we meet again.
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Ciudad de México, Ciudad de México, Mexico

text: He is a very nice person, I liked so much meet he, I hope that the next time we can find more time to talk and enjoy.

I owe this for ages for my amazing friend! Time to pay back, Simon! :D
Simon is a wonderful friend, no matter it rains or snows or sun is shining bright, it never gets boring with this cheerful guy! Nice to talk about serious things, with you, my friend, equally as drivel... and laugh.. much much :D
ohhhh... ad you should see how crazy the parties are with this guy!!! :D
Simon is also a wonderful musician, who plays different instruments, difficult techniques, sings, writes lyrics, composes, and even is able to construct instruments!!!
Moreover, Simon is broad minded, interested in many things and talkative, he always cooks wonderful food, so hard to find a better combination! Anyone would enjoy his company, because you can prepare a nice dinner, chat, play music, do many crazy things and have a wonderful time together! ;):p

I will do it again!!!

text: I had a short stay with Simon, but it was nonetheless, one of the best experiences. Simon is the sweetest, and his girlfriend, Amelia, is just absolutely lovely. Both made sure that my stay was as comfortable and hospitable as it could be. I enjoyed having lunch and dinner at their place as they are great people to talk to. Simon was very thoughtful and often checked in to make sure I was okay, or didn't get lost in Aarhus. I would definitely recommend Simon as a host, as he can be a great friend!

Simon is a great host, he is interested in what you do and also has many stories about himself to tell. 
His flat is amazing and you will really enjoy your stay in Aarhus. 
He loves music (indeed) and he will be always up for singing a few songs together ;)
TOTALLY RECOMMEND.
This was my first couchsurfing experience and I fully enjoyed it!

What can I say?
I have to be careful, because I used to live with his sister...
...just kidding... ((=

Simon, who likes to be called Schlucki, is a wonderful host and man. He picked us up at the airport and he had good ideas for visiting the city. 
He plays the guitar very well and he taught me how to play the Cachon (yeahhh)- I'll keep practising!
He eats the full content of Danish yoghurt boxes, but just half of the water melon. 
He talks a lot, yap.
We parties all night long and went home on just one bike with an extra scarf, tons of fun!!
What a wonderful weekend, thanks a lot!!

response:
{'id': '7802739', 'text': 'Hmm. I must say i somewhat agree with Nejad who also left a neutral reference. Perhaps it was because Ludemar had hangovers? perhaps because i was a bit sick? maybe i arrived on bad day? there seemed to be a big argument going on the night i stayed in his house. i don't know. 

Ludermar made some very condescending comments about brazil and salvador and that really put me in a bad mood. 

Ludemar also talked a about couchhunters and i'm sorry to hear he has had some bad experiences (maybe he'll consider me a bad experience as well?). the thing is, in a way i felt he was a surferhunter (is such an expression exists). it seemed like he was more obsessed with getting as many surfers as possible in the shortest possible time not really showing great interest in his guests (me). 

Like Nejad wrote: "I found him to be offensive (..)" He sat me down and made me add him as a friend. I'm grateful for letting me stay, but that's all.', 'createdDate': '2011-07-10T18:17:39Z', 'experience': 'neutral', 'relationshipType': 'surf', 'isPostTrip': False, 'to': {'id': '2738391'}, 'from': {'id': '347882', 'publicName': 'Johan Weber', 'publicAddress': {'id': '3053030', 'description': 'Brabrand, Aarhus Municipality, Denmark'}, 'avatarUrl': 'https://s3.amazonaws.com/ht-images.couchsurfing.com/u/347882/ab7bb66b-a429-4f29-bd6c-e420c6f6a687', 'status': 'yes', 'isVerified': True, 'isDeleted': False, 'blockedBy': None}, 'inverseReference': None, 'response': None}

text: We spend a weekend at johan´s place in Aarhus and we must say that he was truly perfect host. He is interesting person with cool lifestyle, lots of travelling experience and easy going and positive attitude. He put an effort to explain us some interesting things about Aarhus and showed us many places where he likes to go, which we would never discover if we did not meet him. He also cooked for us Danish meal and took us to party with his friends and treated us as we were old friends. Indeed, the best guide you can wish. Tak for alt!

text:
Jan Jakob is a kind and helpful person and I had a great stay with him. He showed me around in Aarhus and was very considerately in every concern. When I struggled to find a new place to sleep, he even offered me to stay longer at his place. 
I can definitely recommend him as a host!

Jan Jakob is a very nice guy and he is definitely a great host! He showed me the city, took for a beer with his Danish friends(also for a dinner) and showed me some really funny Danish comedies :)  It was my first couchsurfing experience and it was really good.

Another thing is that he helped me with things you need to do when moving to Denmark.

He really put an effort and cares about the person he is hosting

P.S he makes a really good spaghetti :)))

Mette is a very nice and sweet woman. Everything about her is positive. She made my stay with her very pleasant by her charming company, great food, array of drinks and  interesting conversations. 
She arranged to pick me up from bus station, showed me all over Aarhus in her car, took me out for a lovey lunch besides delicious food at home. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay with her and can easily recommend her as a guest, host or company to anyone. And her little angel Olivia is very sweet and a bundle of joy.
Mette, you are very much welcome to India whenever you can.

text:
Jason stayed at my house for 2 nights. He drove all the way from London to see my area just for a few days. He's a really nice and adaptable guy thus it was a pleasure for me and for my housemates to have him around. Unfortunately I didn't manage to show him around as I was busy with university, but that really showed how independent he can be! He's a smart guy and we had lots of topics to talk about while having a pizza that he kindly offered.

You're always welcome to come back Jason and hopefully I'll be able to meet you and your wife in Denmark!
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Falmouth, England, United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland
column18: {'text': "Edoardo was great. I was welcomed in and offered homemade pasta within 15 minutes of my arrival. text: We hosted  Gergana and friend for their Berlin discovery.  They were able to do a lot of siteseeing.

We had a nice time with Gergana and his boyfriend!
They're nice, open minded and open to share their life's experiences :)
we had nice conversations about our cultures and interests! I m just sorry we had a misunderstanding about the accomodation
Enjoy your trip!!
fromPublicAddressDescriptionfromAvatarUr: Corno di Rosazzo, Friuli-Venezia Giulia, Italy

text: Gergana and her boyfriend were very nice guests. They only stayed for one night, but it was enough to see that they are very nice people. Gergana is an interesting person that knows what she is talking about, it is easy to have a conversation with her. I would recommend to host her!

The time I spent with Gergana and Nikola was very nice, althought it was short. They cooked a vegan version of a traditional Bulgarian food and either the cook and the dinner were both friendly. They are very easy-going and interested in know more about our city and us. Very cooperative. I wish you had a good journey to Valencia and you'll continue enjoying your trip. Kisses!

It was a real pleasure to host carl at my home with is friend august... they are so friendly, nice and cheerfull guys... we shared  a short but nice time in lille... welcome to lille when you want 
I whish you a good trip to your home ;))))))
See you soon in denmark for a big beer :ppp

I hosted Carl and his friend August for 2 nights. They are talented musicians. We hung out together and I learned lot about Danish culture. They are fun and easygoing. Thanks for the good time and help in the cooking. Safe travels. I hope to see you soon in Denmark.
Carl and August are very friendly and aranging. Wish you the Best for the rest of your trip.

Carl and August were great couchsurfers! they were very respectful guests, and really appriceated the fact that they could stay here, and we did as wel. They went off to do their own thing but also hung out for a chat sometimes. they practiced guitar and they are really talented. August made a song and let me hear it, and i was pretty blown away by how good it was. if they ever stay at your home, make sure to ask about it!

Amalie was an absolutely fantastic guest! She's super cool, laid back and very easy to get along with. I wouldn't hesitate to host her again when she next visits Western Australia. Safe travels home Amalie!

Amalie is a super cool girl! Really chilled out and easy going, with a great sense of fun. She makes a lovely guest; respectful and gracious and tidy. A pity it was such a short stay!

Hope you have a ball in Galway!!! You're welcome back any time :)

{'id': '15240593', 'text': "Ronan is a true lifesaver!

text:
I stayed in Amalie's cozy house 2 days with my friend and we are so thankful for it!) She was so kind and friendly. She picked us up from central station, shared her breakfast with us and we talked a lot about many things)
I definitely recommend to stay with Amalie!) I hope we can meet again one day and maybe in Russia, just let me know:) Thank you;))

I hosted Michael and his girlfriend during their stay in nador, and it was totally worth it. They were altogether kind and respectful. they is also a very easy going, relaxed and outspoken. Too bad we didn't spend too much time together, but it was enough to know that he's a responsible and fun guest to have around. 
I would definitely host him again if he's around
Always smiling funny guy

Optimal!

Habe Michael und Freundin für 3 Nächte aufgenommen. Es war cool, Ihnen ein bisschen etwas aus der Arbeit mit Flüchtlingen zu zeigen. Sehr nette Leute, die beiden und als Gäste auch absolut optimal. Keinerlei Probleme. 

Also, gerne wieder, bei Bedarf!

Alles Gute!
